    15                                  ; as below:
    16                                  ;    1) SYSINIT code has been changed from MSDOS 5.0 to MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
    17                                  ;      (except DOUBLESPACE feature! Retro DOS does not use the DOUBLESPACE.)	
    18                                  ;    2) 'iosys6.s' is same with 'iosys5.s' except sysinit code.
    19                                  ;	(Also, MSDOS 5.0 & MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS are almost same except
    20                                  ;	SYSINIT and 'Starting MS-DOS' msg part of MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS.)

    22                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    23                                  
    24                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Multisection binary file format (BIOSDATA & BIOSCODE sections)
    25                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan (Istanbul)
    26                                  
    27                                  ;Note: This code is a part of Retro DOS 4.0 kernel source code
    28                                  ;     (as included binary, 'IOSYS5.BIN') 
    29                                  ;     Equivalent of MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE and BIOSDATA and SYSINIT
    30                                  ;						        (except MSLOAD code)  
    31                                        
    32                                  ;---- Retro DOS v2 (v3) boot sector loads RETRODOS.SYS (MSDOS.SYS)
    33                                  ;     at 1000h:0000h and loader (initialization) part of RETRODOS kernel
    34                                  ;     moves IO.SYS (DOSBIOSCODE & DOSBIOSDATA, 'IOSYS5.BIN') to 70h:0000h.
    35                                  ;     Then SYSINIT code to the next segment (46Dh for original MSDOS 5.0)..
    36                                  ;     SYSINIT code relocates itself and DOSBIOSCODE and MSDOS.SYS
    37                                  ;     (MSDOS5.BIN) according to request/setting in 'config.sys' file.
    38                                  
    39                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    40

    42                                  ;

    44                                  ;secperclust	db ?			; base 10
    45                                  ;rsvdsecs	dw ?			; base 10

    47                                  ;rootdirents	dw ?			; base 10

    57                                  ;
    58                                  ;bpbx		ends

   153                                  ;============================================================================
   154                                  ;
   155                                  ;     for dos 4.00, msload program has been changed to allow:
   156                                  ;	  1. 32 bit calculation,
   157                                  ;	  2. reading a fat sector when needed, instead of reading the whole
   158                                  ;	     fat sectors at once. this will make the boot time faster,
   159                                  ;	     and eliminate the memory size limitation problem,
   160                                  ;	  3. solving the limitation of the file size (29 kb) of io.sys0,
   161                                  ;	  4. adding the boot error message. show the same boot error message
   162                                  ;	     and do the same behavior when the read operation of io.sys
   163                                  ;	     fails as the msboot program, since msload program is the
   164                                  ;	     extention of msboot program.

   260                                  ; SaveInputValues
   261                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   262                                  ; INPUT:     none
   263                                  ;
   264                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
   265                                  ;   ch = media byte
   266                                  ;   bx = first data sector (low) on disk (0-based)
   267                                  ;   ds:si = original rom bios diskette parameter table.
   268                                  ;
   269                                  ; if an extended boot record, then ax will be the first data sector
   270                                  ; high word. save ax and set FirstSectorH according to ax if it is an
   271                                  ; extended boot record.
   272                                  ;
   273                                  ;   ax = first data sector (high) on disk ;
   274                                  ; OUTPUT:
   275                                  ;
   276                                  ;   bx = first data sector on disk
   277                                  ;
   278                                  ;   MediaByte = input ch
   279                                  ;   BootDrive = input dl
   280                                  ;   FirstSectorL = input bx
   281                                  ;   FirstSectorH = input AX, if an extended boot record.;j.k.
   282                                  ;   TotalSectorsL = maximum sector number in this media ;j.k.
   283                                  ;   TotalSectorsH = high word of the above
   284                                  ;   HiddenSectorsL = hidden secotrs
   285                                  ;   HiddenSectorsH
   286                                  ;   ReservSectors = reserved sectors
   287                                  ;   SecPerTrack = sectors/track
   288                                  ;   NumHeads = heads/cylinder
   289                                  ;
   290                                  ;   ds = 0
   291                                  ;   AX,DX,SI destroyed

   293                                  ; calls:     none

   503                                  ; Relocate
   504                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   505                                  ;
   506                                  ; NOTES:
   507                                  ;
   508                                  ;   Relocates the loader code to top-of-memory.
   509                                  ;
   510                                  ; INPUT:     none
   511                                  ;
   512                                  ; OUTPUT:    code and data relocated.
   513                                  ;	     AX,CX,SI,DI destroyed
   514                                  ;
   515                                  ; calls:     none
   516                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   517                                  ;
   518                                  ; Determine the number of paragraphs (16 byte blocks) of memory.
   519                                  ; this involves invoking the memory size determination interrupt,
   520                                  ; which returns the number of 1k blocks of memory, and then
   521                                  ; converting this to the number of paragraphs.
   522                                  ; Find out whether RPL code is present at top of memory and modify the
   523                                  ; available amount of memory in AX
   524                                  ; leave the number of paragraphs of memory in ax.
   525                                  ;
   526                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   527                                  ; copy code from start to top of memory.
   528                                  ;
   529                                  ; the length to copy is EndOfLoader
   530                                  ;
   531                                  ; jump to relocated code
   532                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   533                                  
   534                                  		; 14/09/2023
   535                                  relocate:
   536                                  		; 24/12/2022
   537                                  		;cld
   538                                  
   539 000000C6 31F6                    		xor	si, si
   540                                  		; 14/09/2023
   541                                  		;mov	di, si
   542                                  		; di = 0
   543

   545                                  					; Return: AX = number of contiguous 1K blocks of memory
   546 000000CA B106                    		mov	cl, 6
   547 000000CC D3E0                    		shl	ax, cl		; Memory size in paragraphs
   548                                  
   549                                  ;------ Check if an RPL program is present at TOM and do not tromp over it
   550                                  
   551                                  		; 10/12/2022
   552                                  		; ds = 0

   555                                  		;xor	bx, bx

   557                                  		; 14/09/2023

   559                                  		
   560                                  		;mov	bx, [DskAddr+44h] ; 2Fh*4 (Int 2Fh)

   565

   586 000000F9 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx

   644                                  ; FindClusterSize
   645                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   646                                  ;
   647                                  ; INPUT:     bpb information in loaded boot record at 0:7c00h
   648                                  ;

   690                                  ;   to find out what system id byte is.

   761                                  ; ReadInFirstClusters
   762                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   763                                  ;
   764                                  ; NOTES: read the start of the clusters that covers at least IbmLoadSize
   765                                  ;	 fully.  for example, if sector/cluster = 2, and IbmLoadSize=3
   766                                  ;	 then we are going to re-read the second cluster to fully cover
   767                                  ;	 msload program in the cluster boundary.
   768                                  ;
   769                                  ; INPUT:
   770                                  ;   IbmLoadSize - make sure this value is the same as the one in
   771                                  ;		  msboot program when you build the new version!!!!!
   772                                  ;
   773                                  ;   SecPerCluster
   774                                  ;   ClusterSize
   775                                  ;   FirstSectorL
   776                                  ;   FirstSectorH
   777                                  ;
   778                                  ; OUTPUT: msload program is fully covered in a cluster boundary.
   779                                  ;	  ax = # of clusters we read in so far.
   780                                  ;
   781                                  ; calls:     ReadSectors
   782                                  ; logic:
   783                                  ;	ax; dx = IbmLoadSize / # of sector in a cluster.
   784                                  ;	if dx = 0 then ok. (msload is in a cluster boundary.)
   785                                  ;      else		   (has to read (ax+1)th cluster to cover msload)
   786                                  ;	read (ax+1)th cluster into the address after the clusters we
   787                                  ;	read in so far.
   788                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   789                                  
   790                                  ; 09/12/2022
   791                                  ; BiosStart equ 51Ah ; AX = IO.SYS starting cluster
   792                                  ; IbmLoadSize equ 3  ; AX = Number sectors in MSLOAD
   793                                  ; BiosOffset equ 700h ; Address where loader was read in
   794                                  	
   795                                  ReadInFirstClusters:
   796                                  		; 24/12/2022
   797                                  		;;mov	ax, [BioSStart]
   798                                  		;mov	ax, [51Ah]	; IO.SYS First Cluster
   799                                  		;dec	ax		; Root dir buffer at 500h (segment=0)
   800                                  		;			; IO.SYS first cluster ptr at 51Ah
   801                                  		;dec	ax		; AX = word [51Ah] - 2
   802                                  		;;mov	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax ;  Initialize to this cluster
   803                                  		; 24/12/2022
   804                                  		; ds = cs
   805                                  		;mov	[CurrentCluster], ax
   806                                  		; 24/12/2022
   807                                  		; [CurrentCluster] = word [51Ah] - 2
   808                                  
   809                                  		;mov	ax, IbmLoadSize
   810 00000162 B80300                  		mov	ax, 3		; Load the 3rd and other IO.SYS	sectors
   811 00000165 F6F1                    		div	cl ; *#*
   812                                  		;div	byte [SecPerCluster]
   813                                  		;;div	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   814                                  					; AL = total cluster read in
   815                                  					; AH = remaining sectors in last cluster
   816                                  		; 10/12/2022

   818                                  		;cmp	ah, 0
   819 00000169 7433                    		jz	short SetNextClusterNum	; next cluster
   820                                  
   821 0000016B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
   822 0000016D 50                      		push	ax		; AX = total clusters in the loader
   823                                  					; already read in
   824                                  ; 24/12/2022
   825                                  %if 0		
   826                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorL] ;	Put starting sector of disk data
   827                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   828                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
   829                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], cx
   830                                  		mul	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   831                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax ; Add number of sectors already loaded
   832                                  		adc	word [cs:StartSecH], 0 ; to start sector
   833                                  		;mov	ax, [BiosStart]

   835                                  		dec	ax
   836                                  		dec	ax

   840                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax

   843                                  					; the rest of the last loader cluster

   856                                  		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   857                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now

   894 00000182 1116[0800]              		adc	[StartSecH], dx
   895                                  					; abs start sector for next read of

   900                                  		;mov	di, BiosOffset

   904 00000193 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES = segment 0

   911 00000199 E86700                  		call	ReadSectors
   912 0000019C 58                      		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   913 0000019D 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   914                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   915 0000019E 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2
   916 0000019F 0106[0E00]              		add	[CurrentCluster], ax

   918                                  					; AX = number of clusters loaded
   919                                  		
   920                                  ; SaveLoadedBios
   921                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   922                                  ;
   923                                  ; NOTES:
   924                                  ;
   925                                  ;   Determine how much of iosys was loaded in when the loader was loaded
   926                                  ;   by the boot record (only the portion that is guaranteed to be contiguous)
   927                                  ;
   928                                  ; INPUT:
   929                                  ;   AX:Total cluster already read in (loader & bios)
   930                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster = number of clusters used for loader+2
   931                                  ;
   932                                  ; OUTPUT:
   933                                  ;	ES = 70h
   934                                  ;	DI = next offset to load iosys code
   935                                  ;	AX,BX,CX,DX,SI destroyed
   936                                  ;
   937                                  ;	CS:NextBioLocation = di on output
   938                                  ;	CS:last_cluster = last cluster loaded
   939                                  ;
   940                                  ; calls:     none
   941                                  ;
   942                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   943                                  ;
   944                                  ; Multiply cluster * cluster size in bytes to get total loaded for msload
   945                                  ;
   946                                  ; Subtract total_loaded - (EndOfLoader) to get loaded io.sys in last cluster
   947                                  ;
   948                                  ; Relocate this piece of iosys down to 70:0
   949                                  ;
   950                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

   978                                  ; GetContigClusters
   979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   980                                  ;
   981                                  ; NOTES: go find clusters as long as they are contiguous
   982                                  ;
   983                                  ;
   984                                  ; INPUT:
   985                                  ;   CS:NextBioLocation
   986                                  ;   CS:
   987                                  ;
   988                                  ; OUTPUT:
   989                                  ;
   990                                  ; calls: GetNextFatEntry
   991                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   992                                  ;
   993                                  ;Set CS:SectorCount to sectors per cluster
   994                                  ;
   995                                  ;Call GetNextFatEntry to get next cluster in file
   996                                  ;
   997                                  ;Call check_for_eof
   998                                  ;
   999                                  ;if (nc returned)
  1000                                  ;
  1001                                  ;   {call GetNextFatEntry
  1002                                  ;
  1003                                  ;    if (new cluster is contig to old cluster)
  1004                                  ;	{add sectors per cluster to CS:SectorCount
  1005                                  ;
  1006                                  ;	 call check_for_eof
  1007                                  ;
  1008                                  ;	 if (nc returned)
  1009                                  ;
  1010                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1011                                  
  1012                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1013                                  ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1014                                  ; DosLoadSeg equ 70h
  1015                                  
  1016                                  GetContigClusters:
  1017                                  
  1018                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1019                                  %if 0	
  1020                                  		xor	ah, ah
  1021                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1022                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1023                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1024                                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1025                                  		pop	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1026                                  		mov	word [cs:CurrentCluster], ax ; Update the last one found
  1027                                  		cmp	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; END_OF_FILE
  1028                                  		jz	short GoToBioInit
  1029                                  		xor	dx, dx
  1030                                  		;sub	ax, 2			; Zero base the cluster
  1031                                  		; 10/12/2022
  1032                                  		dec	ax
  1033                                  		dec	ax
  1034                                  		xor	ch, ch
  1035                                  		mov	cl, [cs:SecPerCluster]
  1036                                  		mul	cx			; How many sectors (before next cluster) 
  1037                                  		add	ax, [cs:FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1038                                  		adc	dx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1039                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax	; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1040                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx
  1041                                  		mov	di, [cs:NextBioLocation] ; Get where to put code
  1042                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]	; Save how many sectors
  1043                                  		;mov	ax, DosLoadSeg
  1044                                  		mov	ax, 70h
  1045                                  		mov	es, ax
  1046                                  		call	ReadSectors
  1047                                  		pop	ax			; Get back total sectors read in
  1048                                  		mul	word [cs:BytesPerSec]	; Get number of bytes we loaded
  1049                                  		add	[cs:NextBioLocation], ax ; Point to where to load next	
  1050                                  		jmp	short GetContigClusters
  1051                                  
  1052                                  %endif
  1053                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1054                                  		; ds = cs
  1055                                  
  1056 000001BD A1[1200]                		mov	ax, [SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1057 000001C0 A3[0C00]                		mov	[SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1058                                  		;push	word [SectorCount]
  1059 000001C3 50                      		push	ax
  1060 000001C4 E8AF00                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1061 000001C7 8F06[0C00]              		pop	word [SectorCount]
  1062 000001CB A3[0E00]                		mov	[CurrentCluster], ax	; Update the last one found
  1063                                  
  1064 000001CE 803E[2900]FF            		cmp	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh	; END_OF_FILE
  1065 000001D3 741A                    		je	short GoToBioInit ; 23/12/2022

  1077 000001DB 0306[2200]              		add	ax, [FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts

  1090                                  
  1091                                  ; GoToBiosInit
  1092                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1093                                  ;
  1094                                  ; NOTES:
  1095                                  ;
  1096                                  ;  Set up required registers for iosys, then jump to it (70:0)
  1097                                  ;
  1098                                  ; INPUT:     none
  1099                                  ;
  1100                                  ;   CS:MediaByte = media byte
  1101                                  ;   CS:BootDrive = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1102                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorL = first data sector on disk (low) (0-based)
  1103                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorH = first data sector on disk (high)
  1104                                  ;
  1105                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1106                                  ;
  1107                                  ;   required by msinit
  1108                                  ;   DL = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1109                                  ;   CH = media byte
  1110                                  ;   BX = first data sector on disk (0-based)
  1111                                  ;   AX = first data sector on disk (high)
  1112                                  ;   DI = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  1113                                  ;
  1114                                  ; calls:     none
  1115                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1116                                  ;
  1117                                  ; set up registers for msinit then do far jmp
  1118                                  ;
  1119                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1120                                  
  1121                                  GoToBioInit:	
  1122                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1123                                  		; ds = cs	
  1124                                  		;mov	ch, [cs:MediaByte]
  1125                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:BootDrive]
  1126                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:FirstSectorL]
  1127                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1128                                  
  1129 000001EF 8A2E[2800]              		mov	ch, [MediaByte] ; Restore regs required for msint
  1130 000001F3 8A16[2600]              		mov	dl, [BootDrive] ; Physical drv number we booted from.
  1131 000001F7 8B1E[2200]              		mov	bx, [FirstSectorL] ; AX:BX = first data sector of disk
  1132 000001FB A1[2400]                		mov	ax, [FirstSectorH]
  1133                                  
  1134                                  		; 15/09/2023 (retrodos 4.s, retrodos41.s, retrodos42.s)
  1135                                  		; (This is not necessary but BP value will be 7C00h
  1136                                  		; when the RetroDOS boot sector code starts the kernel.
  1137                                  		; Retro DOS 4 Kernel source code contains a comment that
  1138                                  		; 'bp = 7C00h' at the init stage. But RetroDOS kernel
  1139                                  		; doesn't use it later. However, i want to leave BP
  1140                                  		; as equal to SP here.) ---rd4load.s---
  1141                                  		;
  1142                                  		; 15/09/2023 (iosys5.s, iosys51.s, iosys6.s)
  1143                                  		; (The BP value here will not be used by IO.SYS later.
  1144                                  		;  It is not necessary to set.) 
  1145                                  		;
  1146                                  		;mov	bp, sp	; 7C00h ; 15/09/2023
  1147                                  
  1148 000001FE EA00007000              		jmp	70h:0	; Far jump to IoSysAddr	(DOSBIOS)
  1149                                  
  1150                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1151                                  
  1152                                  ; ReadSectors
  1153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1154                                  ; notES:
  1155                                  ;
  1156                                  ;  read in the CS:SectorCount number of sectors at ES:di
  1157                                  ;
  1158                                  ;
  1159                                  ; INPUT:
  1160                                  ;
  1161                                  ;   DI = OFFSET of start of read
  1162                                  ;   ES = segment of read
  1163                                  ;   CS:SectorCount = number of sectors to read
  1164                                  ;   CS:StartSecL = starting sector (low)
  1165                                  ;   CS:StartSecH = starting sector (high)
  1166                                  ;   following is bpb info that must be setup prior to call
  1167                                  ;   CS:NumHeads
  1168                                  ;   CS:number_of_sectors
  1169                                  ;   CS:BootDrive
  1170                                  ;   CS:SecPerTrack
  1171                                  ;
  1172                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1173                                  ;
  1174                                  ;   AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI destroyed
  1175                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1176                                  ; divide start sector by sectors per track
  1177                                  ; the remainder is the actual sector number, 0 based
  1178                                  ;
  1179                                  ; increment actual sector number to get 1 based
  1180                                  ;
  1181                                  ; the quotient is the number of tracks - divide by heads to get the cyl
  1182                                  ;
  1183                                  ; the remainder is actual head, the quotient is cylinder
  1184                                  ;
  1185                                  ; figure the number of sectors in that track, set al to this
  1186                                  ;
  1187                                  ; do the read
  1188                                  ;
  1189                                  ; if error, do reset, then redo the int 13h
  1190                                  ;
  1191                                  ; if successful read, subtract # sectors read from SectorCount, add to logical
  1192                                  ; sector, add #sectors read * BytesPerSec to bx;
  1193                                  ;
  1194                                  ; if SectorCount <> 0 do next read
  1195                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1196                                  
  1197                                  
  1198                                  		; 15/09/2023
  1199                                  ReadSectors:
  1200                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1201                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1202                                  ReadSectors:

  1204

  1247                                  		;jnb	short GotLength		; than what we need to read?

  1250                                  		;;mov	si, [cs:SectorCount]	; Yes, only read what we need to
  1251                                  ;GotLength:
  1252                                  
  1253                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1254                                  		; IO.SYS < 40KB (segment override is not possible)
  1255                                  		; 700h+0F8FFh < 64KB address 
  1256                                  		;	(there is not an override risk up to 63743 bytes)
  1257                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1258                                  %if 0
  1259                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1260                                  		; dma boundary check for >64KB reads
  1261                                  		; Also, Segment Override risk !
  1262                                  		or	di, di
  1263                                  		jz	short dma_boundary_ok ; no problem for the 1st read
  1264                                  		;cmp	byte [BootDrive], 80h
  1265                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:BootDrive], 80h
  1266                                  		;jnb	short dma_boundary_ok ; no problem for hard disks
  1267                                  dma_boundary_chk:
  1268                                  		cmp	si, 1
  1269                                  		jna	short dma_boundary_ok 
  1270                                  				; 1 sector read will not cause a boundary error			
  1271                                  		push	dx
  1272                                  		push	ax
  1273                                  		mov	ax, si
  1274                                  		sub	dx, dx
  1275                                  		mul	word [BytesPerSec]
  1276                                  		mov	bx, es

  1279                                  		; bx = segment start position (for 64K memory sections)

  1281                                  		pop	ax
  1282                                  		pop	dx

  1284                                  		jnc	short dma_boundary_ok
  1285

  1287                                  		; DMA boundary error or segment override risk!
  1288                                  		dec	si
  1289                                  		jmp	short dma_boundary_chk

  1291                                  %endif

  1424                                  		
  1425                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1426                                  ;EndRead:
  1427                                  		;retn
  1428                                  
  1429                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1430                                  
  1431                                  ; GetNextFatEntry
  1432                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1433                                  ;
  1434                                  ; NOTES:
  1435                                  ;
  1436                                  ;   given the last cluster found, this will return the next cluster of
  1437                                  ;   iosys. if the last cluster is (f)ff8 - (f)fff, then the final cluster
  1438                                  ;   of iosys has been loaded, and control is passed to goto_iosys
  1439                                  ;   msload can handle maximum fat area size of 128 kb.
  1440                                  ;
  1441                                  ; INPUT:
  1442                                  ;
  1443                                  ;    CS:CurrentCluster
  1444                                  ;    CS:FatSize
  1445                                  ;
  1446                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1447                                  ;
  1448                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster (updated)
  1449                                  ;
  1450                                  ; calls:  GetFatSector
  1451                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1452                                  ; get CurrentCluster
  1453                                  ;
  1454                                  ; if (16 bit fat)
  1455                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = fff8 - ffff)
  1456                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1457                                  ;     else
  1458                                  ;	{get OFFSET by multiply cluster by 2}
  1459                                  ;
  1460                                  ; else
  1461                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = ff8 - fff)
  1462                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1463                                  ;     else
  1464                                  ;	{get OFFSET by	- multiply cluster by 3
  1465                                  ;
  1466                                  ;	 rotate right to divide by 2
  1467                                  ;
  1468                                  ;	 if (cy set - means odd number)
  1469                                  ;	    {shr 4 times to keep high twelve bits}
  1470                                  ;
  1471                                  ;	 else
  1472                                  ;	    {and with 0fffh to keep low 12 bits}
  1473                                  ;	}
  1474                                  ;    }
  1475                                  ;
  1476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1477                                  
  1478                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1479                                  ; FAT_12_BIT equ 1
  1480                                  ; NOT_END_OF_FILE equ 0  ; ~END_OF_FILE ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1481                                  
  1482                                  GetNextFatEntry:
  1483 00000276 06                      		push	es
  1484                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1485                                  		; ds = cs
  1486                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FatSegment]
  1487 00000277 A1[3200]                		mov	ax, [FatSegment]
  1488 0000027A 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES-> FAT area segment
  1489                                  		; 09/12/2022
  1490                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], END_OF_FILE
  1491                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1492                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1493                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1494                                  		; ds = cs
  1495 0000027C C606[2900]FF            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1496 00000281 A1[0E00]                		mov	ax, [CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1497 00000284 803E[2700]01            		cmp	byte [Fatsize], 1
  1498                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:FatSize], FAT_12_BIT
  1499                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:Fatsize], 1
  1500 00000289 7537                    		jne	short Got16Bit	; 23/12/2022
  1501 0000028B 89C6                    		mov	si, ax
  1502 0000028D D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  1503 0000028F 01C6                    		add	si, ax		; SI = AX * 1.5 = AX + AX/2
  1504                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1505                                  		;push	dx
  1506                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1507 00000291 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1508 00000293 E84700                  		call	GetFatSector
  1509                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1510                                  		;pop	dx
  1511 00000296 7510                    		jnz	short ClusterOk
  1512 00000298 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]
  1513                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1514                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster], al
  1515                                  		;push	ax ; (*)
  1516 0000029B 46                      		inc	si
  1517                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1518                                  		;push	dx
  1519 0000029C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1520 0000029E E83C00                  		call	GetFatSector	; Read next fat sector
  1521                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1522                                  		;pop	dx
  1523                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1524                                  		;mov	al, [es:0]
  1525                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster+1], al
  1526                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:TempCluster]
  1527                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1528                                  		;pop	ax ; (*) 
  1529 000002A1 268A260000              		mov	ah, [es:0]
  1530 000002A6 EB03                    		jmp	short EvenOdd
  1531                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1532                                  
  1533                                  ClusterOk:				
  1534 000002A8 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1535                                  EvenOdd:	
  1536                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1537                                  		; ds = cs
  1538 000002AB F606[0E00]01            		test	byte [CurrentCluster], 1
  1539                                  		; 10/12/2022		
  1540                                  		;test	byte [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; 09/12/2022
  1541                                  		;;test	word [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; Was last cluster odd?
  1542 000002B0 7505                    		jnz	short OddResult		; If not zero it was odd
  1543 000002B2 25FF0F                  		and	ax, 0FFFh		; Keep low 12 bits
  1544 000002B5 EB04                    		jmp	short TestEOF
  1545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1546                                  
  1547                                  OddResult:				
  1548 000002B7 B104                    		mov	cl, 4			; Keep high 12 bits for odd
  1549 000002B9 D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl
  1550                                  TestEOF:				
  1551 000002BB 3DF80F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF8h		; Is it last cluster?
  1552 000002BE 731B                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone	; Yep, all done here
  1553 000002C0 EB14                    		jmp	short NotLastCluster
  1554                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1555                                  
  1556                                  Got16Bit:
  1557                                  		; 23/12/2022				
  1558                                  		;push	dx
  1559                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1560 000002C2 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1561 000002C4 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1			; Multiply cluster by 2
  1562 000002C6 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  1563 000002C9 89C6                    		mov	si, ax			; Get the final buffer OFFSET
  1564 000002CB E80F00                  		call	GetFatSector
  1565                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1566                                  		;pop	dx
  1567 000002CE 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1568 000002D1 83F8F8                  		cmp	ax, 0FFF8h
  1569 000002D4 7305                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone
  1570                                  NotLastCluster:	
  1571                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1572                                  		; ds = cs			
  1573                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], NOT_END_OF_FILE ; ~END_OF_FILE
  1574                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1575 000002D6 C606[2900]00            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1576                                  GotClusterDone:				
  1577 000002DB 07                      		pop	es
  1578                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1579                                  EndRead:
  1580 000002DC C3                      		retn
  1581                                  
  1582                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1583                                  
  1584                                  ; GetFatSector
  1585                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1586                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ES:0
  1587                                  ;
  1588                                  ;in). SI = offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find.
  1589                                  ;     ES = fat sector segment
  1590                                  ;     CS:BytesPerSec
  1591                                  ;
  1592                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  1593                                  ;      BX = offset value of the corresponding fat entry in the fat sector.
  1594                                  ;      CX destroyed.
  1595                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e. when 12 bit fat entry
  1596                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  1597                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  1598                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat).
  1599                                  ;
  1600                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1601                                  
  1602                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1603                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1604                                  GetFatSector:
  1605 000002DD 50                      		push	ax
  1606 000002DE 56                      		push	si
  1607 000002DF 57                      		push	di
  1608 000002E0 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  1609                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1610                                  		; ds = cs
  1611                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1612                                  		;div	cx			; AX = Sector number, DX = Offset
  1613 000002E2 F736[1000]              		div	word [BytesPerSec]
  1614 000002E6 3B06[0A00]              		cmp	ax, [LastFatSector]
  1615                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:LastFatSector]	; The same fat sector?
  1616 000002EA 7421                    		je	short SplitChk		; Don't need to read it again.
  1617 000002EC A3[0A00]                		mov	[LastFatSector], ax
  1618                                  		;mov	[cs:LastFatSector], ax
  1619 000002EF 52                      		push	dx
  1620                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1621 000002F0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1622                                  		;add	ax, [cs:HiddenSectorsL]
  1623                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:HiddenSectorsH]
  1624                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]
  1625                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  1626                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1627                                  		; ds = cs
  1628 000002F2 0306[2E00]              		add	ax, [FatStartSecL]
  1629 000002F6 1316[3000]              		adc	dx, [FatStartSecH]
  1630 000002FA A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax
  1631 000002FD 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx		; Set up for ReadSectors
  1632                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax
  1633                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx	; Set up for ReadSectors
  1634                                  		
  1635 00000301 C706[0C00]0100          		mov	word [SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector			
  1636                                  		;mov	word [cs:SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector
  1637 00000307 31FF                    		xor	di, di ; 0
  1638                                  		; es:di = FATSEGMENT:0000h
  1639 00000309 E8F7FE                  		call	ReadSectors
  1640 0000030C 5A                      		pop	dx
  1641                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1642                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1643                                  SplitChk:
  1644                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1645 0000030D 8B0E[1000]              		mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]				
  1646 00000311 49                      		dec	cx			; CX = SECTOR SIZE - 1
  1647 00000312 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx			; If last byte of sector, splitted entry.
  1648 00000314 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx			; set bx to dx
  1649 00000316 5F                      		pop	di
  1650 00000317 5E                      		pop	si
  1651 00000318 58                      		pop	ax
  1652                                  EndWrite:		; 10/12/2022
  1653 00000319 C3                      		retn
  1654                                  
  1655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1656                                  
  1657                                  ErrorOut:
  1658                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1659                                  		; ds = cs
  1660                                  		;push	cs
  1661                                  		;pop	ds
  1662                                  		
  1663 0000031A BE[4103]                		mov	si, NonSystemDiskMsg ; "\r\nNon-System disk or disk error\r\nRe"...
  1664 0000031D E81400                  		call	WriteTTY
  1665                                  
  1666                                  		; Wait for a keypress on the keyboard.
  1667                                  		; Use the bios keyboard interrupt.
  1668                                  
  1669 00000320 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  1670 00000322 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  1671                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  1672                                  
  1673                                  		; We have to restore the address of the original rom disk
  1674                                  		; parameter table to the location at [0:DskAddr]. The address
  1675                                  		; of this original table has been saved previously in
  1676                                  		; 0:OrgDasdPtr and 0:OrgDasdPtr+2. After this table address
  1677                                  		; has been restored we can reboot by invoking the bootstrap
  1678                                  		; loader bios interrupt.
  1679                                  
  1680                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1681                                  		;xor	bx, bx
  1682                                  		;mov	ds, bx
  1683                                  		;les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Wrong DS segment !
  1684                                  					 ; (Erdogan Tan, 23/12/2022)
  1685 00000324 C41E[2A00]              		les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Correct DS segment = CS
  1686                                  		
  1687                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1688 00000328 16                      		push	ss ; 0
  1689 00000329 1F                      		pop	ds
  1690                                  		; ds = 0		
  1691                                  
  1692 0000032A BE7800                  		mov	si, DskAddr	; (Int 1Eh)
  1693 0000032D 891C                    		mov	[si], bx	; restore offset		
  1694 0000032F 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; restore segment
  1695 00000332 CD19                    		int	19h		; reboot
  1696                                  
  1697                                  
  1698                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1699                                  
  1700                                  ; WriteTTY
  1701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1702                                  ; in) DS:si -> asciiz string.
  1703                                  ;
  1704                                  ; WriteTTY the character in al to the screen.
  1705                                  ; use video service 'write teletype to active page' (ROM_TTY)
  1706                                  ; use normal character attribute
  1707                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1708                                  
  1709                                  WriteTTY:
  1710 00000334 AC                      		lodsb
  1711 00000335 08C0                    		or	al, al
  1712 00000337 74E0                    		jz	short EndWrite
  1713                                  		;mov	AH, ROM_TTY	; 09/12/2022
  1714 00000339 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  1715 0000033B B307                    		mov	bl, 7		; "normal" attribute
  1716 0000033D CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  1717                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  1718                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  1719 0000033F EBF3                    		jmp	short WriteTTY
  1720                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1721                                  
  1722                                  ; 10/12/2022	
  1723                                  ;EndWrite:
  1724                                  ;		retn
  1725                                  
  1726                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1727

  1747                                  ;=============================================================================
  1748                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) DATA SEGMENT 
  1749                                  ;=============================================================================
  1750                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  1751                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
  1752                                  
  1753                                  section .BIOSDATA vstart=0
  1754                                  
  1755                                  ;--- DOSBIOS data segment ----------------------------------------------------
  1756                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1757                                  
  1758                                  ;Bios_Data segment
  1759                                  
  1760                                  BData_start:				
  1761 00000000 E92B16                  hdrv_pat:	jmp	init		; MSBIO1.ASM, MSSBDATA.INC
  1762                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1763                                  
  1764 00000003 0000                    DosDataSg:	dw 0
  1765                                  
  1766                                  ; DOS's int 2f handler will exit via a jump through here.
  1767                                  ; This is how the BIOS hooks int2f
  1768                                  			
  1769                                  ;BIOSDATA:0005h: ; 10/05/2023 (Note the 'bios_i2f equ 5' in 'msdos6.s')
  1770                                  			
  1771 00000005 EA                      bios_i2f:	db 0EAh			; far jump to int_2f (segment may not be at 70h)
  1772                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  1773                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIODATA:0006h
  1774                                  		;dw int_2f
  1775                                  		;dw 70h			; BIOSDATA segment (KERNEL_SEGMENT)
  1776 00000006 [4313]                  		dw i2f_handler	
  1777                                  bios_i2f_seg:	; 10/08/2023
  1778 00000008 9D02                    		dw DOSBIOCODESEG	; 02CCh for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS (25Ch+070h)
  1779                                  					; 0364h PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM  (2F4h+070h)
  1780                                  
  1781 0000000A 0000                    romstartaddr:	dw 0			; The start address for the romfind routines
  1782                                  					; This is to maintain binary compatibility
  1783                                  					; with DISK based DOS 5.0
  1784                                  
  1785                                  ; This is a byte used for special key handling in the resident
  1786                                  ; console device driver. It must be here so that it can be included
  1787                                  ; in the WIN386 instance table (in INC\LMSTUB.ASM).
  1788                                  
  1789 0000000C 00                      altah:		db 0			; special key handling
  1790                                  			
  1791 0000000D 00                      inHMA:		db 0			; flag indicates we're running from HMA
  1792 0000000E 00000000                xms:		dd 0			; entry point to xms if above is true
  1793                                  
  1794                                  ; PTRSAV - pointer save
  1795                                  ;
  1796                                  ; This variable holds the pointer to the Request Header passed by a program
  1797                                  ; wishing to use a device driver. When the strategy routine is called it 
  1798                                  ; puts the address of the Request header in this variable and returns.
  1799                                  		
  1800 00000012 00000000                ptrsav:		dd 0			
  1801                                  auxbuf:		;db 4 dup(0)		; set of 1 byte buffers for com 1,2,3, and 4
  1802 00000016 00000000                		db 0, 0, 0, 0 ; 19/10/2022
  1803 0000001A 0000                    zeroseg:	dw 0			; easy way to load segment registers with zero			
  1804 0000001C 0000                    i13_ds:		dw 0			; ds register for int13 call through	
  1805 0000001E 0000                    prevoper:	dw 0			; holds int 13 request (i.e. register ax).			
  1806 00000020 00                      number_of_sec:	db 0			; holds number of secs. to read on an ecc error
  1807 00000021 0000                    auxnum:		dw 0			; which aux device was requested			
  1808

  1810

  1814

  1935 00000119 [4E03]                  start_bds:	dw bds1			; Start	of linked list of BDS's
  1936 0000011B 7000                    		dw 70h			; KERNEL_SEGMENT
  1937                                  
  1938                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1939                                  ; Some floppy drives do not have changeline support. The result is a
  1940                                  ; large amount of inefficiency in the code. A media-check always returns
  1941                                  ; "I don`t know". This cause DOS to reread the FAT on every access and
  1942                                  ; always discard any cached data.
  1943                                  ;    We get around this inefficiency by implementing a "Logical Door Latch".
  1944                                  ; The following three items are used to do this. The logical door latch is
  1945                                  ; based on the premise that it is not physically possible to change floppy
  1946                                  ; disks in a drive in under two seconds (most people take about 10). The
  1947                                  ; logical door latch is implemented by saving the time of the last successful
  1948                                  ; disk operation (in the value TIM_DRV). When a new request is made the
  1949                                  ; current time is compared to the saved time. If less than two seconds have
  1950                                  ; passed then the value "No Change" is returned. If more than two seconds
  1951                                  ; have passed the value "Don't Know" is returned.
  1952                                  ;    There is one complecation to this algorithm. Some programs change the
  1953                                  ; value of the timer. In this unfortunate case we have an invalid timer.
  1954                                  ; This possibility is detected by counting the number of disk operations
  1955                                  ; which occur without any time passing. If this count exceeds the value of
  1956                                  ; "AccessMax" we assume the counter is invalid and always return "Don't
  1957                                  ; Know". The variable "AccessCount" is used to keep track of the number
  1958                                  ; of disk operation which occur without the time changing.
  1959                                  
  1960 0000011D 00                      accesscount:	db 0			
  1961 0000011E FF                      tim_drv:	db 0FFh			
  1962 0000011F 00                      medbyt:		db 0
  1963                                  wrtverify:	; 15/10/2022			
  1964 00000120 02                      rflag:		db 2			; 2 for	read, 3	for write
  1965 00000121 00                      verify:		db 0			; 1 if verify after write
  1966 00000122 0000                    seccnt:		dw 0			
  1967 00000124 00                      		db 0			; -- pad where hardnum was
  1968 00000125 01                      dsktnum:	db 1			; number of diskette drives			
  1969                                  
  1970                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1971                                  ; Some of the older versions of the IBM rom-bios always assumed a seek would
  1972                                  ; have to be made to read the diskette. Consequently a large head settle
  1973                                  ; time was always used in the I/O operations. To get around this problem
  1974                                  ; we need to continually adjust the head settle time. The following
  1975                                  ; algorithm is used:
  1976                                  ;
  1977                                  ;   Get the current head settle value.
  1978                                  ;   If it is 1, then
  1979                                  ;	set slow = 15
  1980                                  ;   else
  1981                                  ;	set slow = value
  1982                                  ;   ...
  1983                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing then
  1984                                  ;	use slow
  1985                                  ;   else
  1986                                  ;	use fast
  1987                                  ;   ...
  1988                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  1989                                  
  1990 00000126 00                      motorstartup:	db 0			; value from table
  1991 00000127 00                      settlecurrent:	db 0			; value	from table
  1992 00000128 00                      settleslow:	db 0			; slow settle value
  1993 00000129 00                      nextspeed:	db 0			; value	of speed to be used
  1994 0000012A 00                      save_head_sttl:	db 0			; used by read_sector routine
  1995 0000012B 00                      save_eot:	db 0			; saved	eot from the default DPT
  1996 0000012C 09                      eot:		db 9			
  1997 0000012D 00000000                dpt:		dd 0			; pointer to Disk Parameter Table			
  1998 00000131 00                      cursec:		db 0			; current sector
  1999 00000132 00                      curhd:		db 0			; current head
  2000 00000133 0000                    curtrk:		dw 0			; current track
  2001 00000135 0000                    spsav:		dw 0			; save the stack pointer
  2002 00000137 08                      formt_eot:	db 8			; eot used for format
  2003 00000138 00                      hdnum:		db 0			; head number
  2004 00000139 0000                    trknum:		dw 0			; track	being manipulated
  2005 0000013B 50                      gap_patch:	db 50h			; format gap patched into dpt
  2006

  2435                                  ;************************************************************************
  2436                                  ;*									*
  2437                                  ;*	strategy - store es:bx (device driver request packet)		*
  2438                                  ;*		     away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call	*
  2439                                  ;*									*
  2440                                  ;************************************************************************
  2441                                  
  2442                                  strategy:	; proc far		
  2443 000006D0 2E891E[1200]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav], bx ; store es:bx (device driver request packet)
  2444                                  					; away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call
  2445 000006D5 2E8C06[1400]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav+2], es
  2446 000006DA CB                      		retf

  2448                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2449                                  
  2450                                  ;************************************************************************
  2451                                  ;*									*
  2452                                  ;*	device driver entry points. these are the initial		*
  2453                                  ;*	  'interrupt' hooks out of the device driver chain.		*
  2454                                  ;*	  in the case of our resident drivers, they'll just		*
  2455                                  ;*	  stick a fake return address on the stack which		*
  2456                                  ;*	  points to dispatch tables and possibly some unit		*
  2457                                  ;*	  numbers, and then call through a common entry point		*
  2458                                  ;*	  which can take care of a20 switching				*
  2459                                  ;*									*
  2460                                  ;************************************************************************
  2461                                  
  2462                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan
  2463                                  ; (disassembled MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS code here with fixed table
  2464                                  ;  addresses, they will be changed to table labels later)
  2465                                  
  2466                                  ; 09/12/2022
  2467                                  
  2468                                  con_entry:				
  2469 000006DB E84000                  		call	cdev_entry
  2470                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2471                                  		;dw 0E4h		; con_table

  2569                                  
  2570                                  ;************************************************************************
  2571                                  ;*									*
  2572                                  ;*	Ensure A20 is enabled before jumping into code in HMA.		*
  2573                                  ;*	This code assumes that if Segment of Device request packet is	*
  2574                                  ;*	DOS DATA segment then the Device request came from DOS & that	*
  2575                                  ;*	A20 is already on.						*
  2576                                  ;*									*
  2577                                  ;************************************************************************
  2578                                  
  2579                                  cdev_entry:	; proc near		
  2580 0000071E 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2581 00000724 740D                    		jz	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2582                                  				; optimized for DOS in HMA
  2583 00000726 50                      		push	ax
  2584 00000727 2EA1[0300]              		mov	ax, [cs:DosDataSg]
  2585 0000072B 2E3906[1400]            		cmp	[cs:ptrsav+2], ax
  2586 00000730 58                      		pop	ax
  2587 00000731 7505                    		jnz	short not_from_dos
  2588                                  				; jump is coded this way to fall thru
  2589                                  				; in 99.99% of the cases
  2590                                  ce_enter_codeseg:
  2591 00000733 2EFF2E[BD06]            		jmp	far [cs:cdev]			
  2592                                  		;jmp	dword ptr cs:cdev
  2593                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2594                                  
  2595                                  not_from_dos:				
  2596 00000738 E85500                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2597 0000073B EBF6                    		jmp	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2598                                  
  2599                                  ;************************************************************************
  2600                                  ;*									*
  2601                                  ;*	outchr - this is our int 29h handler. it writes the		*
  2602                                  ;*	   character in al on the display using int 10h ttywrite	*
  2603                                  ;*									*
  2604                                  ;************************************************************************
  2605                                  
  2606                                  ; 30/12/2022
  2607                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:0762h)
  2608                                  
  2609                                  outchr:					
  2610 0000073D 50                      		push	ax		; int 29h handler
  2611 0000073E 56                      		push	si
  2612 0000073F 57                      		push	di
  2613 00000740 55                      		push	bp
  2614 00000741 53                      		push	bx
  2615 00000742 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  2616 00000744 BB0700                  		mov	bx, 7
  2617 00000747 CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  2618                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  2619                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  2620 00000749 5B                      		pop	bx
  2621 0000074A 5D                      		pop	bp
  2622 0000074B 5F                      		pop	di
  2623 0000074C 5E                      		pop	si
  2624 0000074D 58                      		pop	ax
  2625 0000074E CF                      		iret
  2626                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2627                                  
  2628                                  ;************************************************************************
  2629                                  ;*									*
  2630                                  ;*	block13 - our int13 hooker					*
  2631                                  ;*									*
  2632                                  ;************************************************************************
  2633                                  
  2634                                  block13:				
  2635 0000074F 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2636 00000755 7408                    		jz	short skipa20
  2637 00000757 E84700                  		call	IsA20Off	; A20 Off?
  2638 0000075A 7503                    		jnz	short skipa20
  2639 0000075C E83600                  		call	EnableA20	; assure a20 enabled
  2640                                  
  2641                                  skipa20:				
  2642 0000075F 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds	; save caller's ds for call-through
  2643 00000764 9C                      		pushf			; fake interrupt
  2644 00000765 2EFF1E[C506]            		call	far [cs:i13x]
  2645                                  		;call	dword ptr cs:i13x
  2646                                  					; call through Bios_Code entry table
  2647 0000076A 2E8E1E[1C00]            		mov	ds, [cs:i13_ds]
  2648 0000076F CA0200                  		retf	2
  2649                                  
  2650                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  2651                                  
  2652                                  ; the int13 hook calls back here to call-through to the ROM
  2653                                  ; this is necessary because some people have extended their
  2654                                  ; ROM BIOSs to use ds as a parameter/result register and
  2655                                  ; our int13 hook relies heavily on ds to access Bios_Data
  2656                                  
  2657                                  call_orig13:	; proc far		
  2658 00000772 8E1E[1C00]              		mov	ds, [i13_ds]	; get caller's ds register
  2659 00000776 9C                      		pushf			; simulate an int13
  2660 00000777 2EFF1E[B400]            		call	far [cs:Orig13]
  2661                                  		;call	cs:Orig13
  2662 0000077C 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds
  2663 00000781 0E                      		push	cs
  2664 00000782 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore ds ->	Bios_Data before return
  2665                                  
  2666 00000783 9C                      		pushf
  2667                                  		; 10/12/2022
  2668                                  		; ds = cs
  2669 00000784 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; 16/10/2022
  2670                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2671 00000789 7403                    		jz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2672                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  2673                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:0725h	
  2674                                  		;call	IsA20Off
  2675                                  		;jnz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2676                                  		;call	EnableA20
  2677 0000078B E80200                  		call	EnsureA20On ; 07/08/2023
  2678                                  corig13_popf_retf:			
  2679 0000078E 9D                      		popf
  2680                                  re_init:	; 07/08/2023
  2681 0000078F CB                      		retf
  2682

  2697                                  ;************************************************************************
  2698                                  ;*									*
  2699                                  ;*	EnsureA20On - ensure that a20 is enabled if we're running	*
  2700                                  ;*	  in the HMA before interrupt entry points into Bios_Code	*
  2701                                  ;*									*

  2733 000007A5 57                      		push	di
  2734                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  2735                                  		;lds	si, [cs:HiMem]
  2736                                  		;les	di, [cs:LoMem]
  2737                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:0740h
  2738 000007A6 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  2739 000007A8 8EC7                    		mov	es, di

  2744 000007B3 B90800                  		mov	cx, 8
  2745 000007B6 F3A7                    		repe cmpsw
  2746                                  				; zf = 0 -> A20 line is ON
  2747                                  				; zf = 1 -> A20 line is OFF

  2751 000007BB 07                      		pop	es

  2811                                  					; stkinit in sysinit1 will initialize int19oldxx values
  2812                                  		;mov	cx, 14		; num_i19
  2813                                  		; 07/08/2023
  2814 000007DD B10E                    		mov	cl, 14	
  2815                                  i19_restore_loop:

  2817 000007E0 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2818                                  		;mov	di, ax
  2819                                  		;lodsw			; get original vector offset
  2820                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; save it
  2821                                  		;lodsw

  2826 000007E4 AD                      		lodsw

  2831                                  		;jz	short i19_restor_1

  2859                                  ;

  2861                                  ;		If it recognizes ctrl-alt-del and if DOS was
  2862                                  ;		is running high, it Erases the VDISK header
  2863                                  ;		present at 1MB boundary
