  4440                                  ; 08/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4441                                  
  4442                                  ; 20/04/2019
  4443                                  
  4444                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0) IO.SYS
  4445                                  
  4446                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4447                                  BPB48T:
  4448                                  ;bpb48t:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 720, 0FDh, 2, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4449                                  		; 48 tpi diskettes	;
  4450                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4451                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4452                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4453                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4454                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4455                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4456                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4457                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4458                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4459                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4460                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4461                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4462                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4463                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)					
  4464                                  
  4465                                  		db 90h
  4466                                  ;align 2
  4467                                  BPB96T:
  4468                                  ;bpb96t:	; bpbx <512, 1, 1, 2, 224, 2400, 0F9h, 7, 15, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4469                                  		; 96 tpi diskettes	;
  4470                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4471                                  		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4472                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4473                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4474                                  		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4475                                  		dw	2400 ; 2*15*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4476                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4477                                  		dw	7		; number of fat sectors
  4478                                  		dw	15		; sectors per track
  4479                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4480                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4481                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4482                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4483                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4484                                  
  4485                                  		db 90h
  4486                                  ;align 2
  4487                                  BPB35:
  4488                                  ;bpb35:		; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 1440, 0F9h, 3, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4489                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 720 KB ;		
  4490                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4491                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4492                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4493                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4494                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4495                                  		dw	1440 ; 2*9*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4496                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4497                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4498                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4499                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4500                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4501                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4502                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4503                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4504                                  
  4505                                  		db 90h
  4506                                  ;align 2
  4507                                  
  4508                                  ;align 2
  4509                                  ;BPB144:
  4510                                  ;bpb144:	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only !	; 1.44MB diskettes
  4511                                  ;
  4512                                  ;		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4513                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4514                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4515                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4516                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4517                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4518                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4519                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4520                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4521                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4522                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4523                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4524                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4525                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4526                                  ;
  4527                                  ;		db 90h
  4528                                  ;align 2
  4529                                  
  4530                                  BPB288:
  4531                                  ;bpb288:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 240, 5760, 0F0h, 9, 36, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0>
  4532                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;	 
  4533                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4534                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4535                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4536                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4537                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4538                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4539                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4540                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4541                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4542                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4543                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4544                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4545                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4546                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4547                                  
  4548                                  		db 90h			;
  4549                                  ;align 2
  4550                                  
  4551                                  %endif
  4552                                  
  4553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4554                                  					; align	2
  4555                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4556                                  %if 0
  4557                                  bpbtable:	dw bpb48t		; 48tpi	drives
  4558                                  		dw bpb96t		; 96tpi	drives
  4559                                  		dw bpb35		; 3.5" drives
  4560                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4561                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4562                                  		dw bpb35		; used for hard	disk
  4563                                  		dw bpb35		; used for tape	drive
  4564                                  		dw bpb35		; FFOTHER
  4565                                  		dw bpb35		; ERIMO
  4566                                  		dw bpb288		; 2.88MB drive
  4567                                  		;
  4568                                  		;dw bpb144		; 1.44MB drive - Retro DOS v4.0 feature !
  4569                                  %endif
  4570                                  
  4571                                  ; 13/12/2022
  4572                                  %if 0
  4573                                  BPBTABLE:	dw BPB48T		; 48tpi	drives
  4574                                  		dw BPB96T		; 96tpi	drives
  4575                                  		dw BPB35		; 3.5" drives
  4576                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4577                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4578                                  		dw BPB35		; used for hard	disk
  4579                                  		dw BPB35		; used for tape	drive
  4580                                  		dw BPB35		; FFOTHER
  4581                                  		dw BPB35		; ERIMO
  4582                                  		dw BPB288		; 2.88MB drive
  4583                                  		;
  4584                                  		;dw BPB144		; 1.44MB drive - Retro DOS v4.0 feature !
  4585                                  
  4586                                  %endif
  4587                                  
  4588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4589                                  
  4590                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4591                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4592                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4593                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4594                                  ;
  4595                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4596                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4597                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4598                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4599                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4600                                  ;	  and a retf
  4601                                  
  4602                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4603                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4604                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4605                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4606                                  
  4607                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4608                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4609 0000161F [CC00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4610                                  
  4611                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4612                                  
  4613                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4614 00001621 2EFF36[1F16]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4615                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4616 00001626 2EFF36[BF06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4617 0000162B 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4618 0000162C CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4619                                  
  4620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4621                                  
  4622 0000162D 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4623                                  
  4624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4625                                  
  4626                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4627                                  
  4628                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4629                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4630                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4631                                  
  4632                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4633                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4634                                  		;=============================================================
  4635                                  		;
  4636                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4637                                  		;
  4638                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4639                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4640                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4641                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4642                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4643                                  
  4644                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4645                                  		;=============================================================
  4646                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4647                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4648                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4649                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4650                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4651                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4652                                  		
  4653 0000162E FA                      		cli
  4654                                  
  4655                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4656                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4657                                  		;push	ax
  4658                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4659                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4660                                  		;pop	ax
  4661                                  	
  4662                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4663                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4664                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4665                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4666                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4667                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4668                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4669                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4670                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4671                                  
  4672                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4673                                  
  4674                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4675                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4676                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4677                                  
  4678 0000162F 2EA3[8A15]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4679 00001633 2E891E[8815]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4680                                  
  4681                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4682                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4683                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4684                                  
  4685 00001638 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4686 00001639 07                      		pop	es
  4687 0000163A 51                      		push	cx
  4688 0000163B 57                      		push	di
  4689                                  
  4690                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4691                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4692                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4693                                  		; ds = cs
  4694 0000163C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4695 0000163E 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4696                                  		; ds = 0
  4697                                  
  4698 00001640 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4699                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4700                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4701                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4702 00001642 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4703                                  next_int_:		
  4704 00001645 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4705 00001646 AC                      		lodsb		
  4706                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4707 00001647 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4708 00001648 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4709 0000164A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4710 0000164C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4711 0000164E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4712                                  					; saving address in di
  4713 00001650 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4714 00001651 AB                      		stosw
  4715 00001652 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4716 00001653 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4717 00001654 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4718 00001656 E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4719 00001658 5F                      		pop	di
  4720 00001659 59                      		pop	cx
  4721                                  
  4722                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4723                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4724                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4725                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4726                                  
  4727                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4728                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4729                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4730                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4731                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4732                                  
  4733                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4734 0000165A C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4735                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4736                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4737 00001660 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4738                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4739 00001664 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4740                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4741                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4742 0000166A 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4743                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4744 0000166E C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4745                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4746                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4747 00001674 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4748                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4749                                  
  4750                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4751 00001678 0E                      		push	cs
  4752 00001679 1F                      		pop	ds
  4753                                  		
  4754 0000167A A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4755 0000167D A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4756 00001680 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4757 00001683 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4758                                  					; ;
  4759 00001686 FB                      		sti
  4760 00001687 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4761                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4762                                  
  4763                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4764                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4765                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4766                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4767                                  ;
  4768                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4769                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4770                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4771                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4772                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4773                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4774                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4775                                  
  4776                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4777                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4778                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4779                                  ;
  4780                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4781                                  ; to do anything special.
  4782                                  ;
  4783                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4784                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4785                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4786                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4787                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4788                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4789                                  
  4790                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4791 00001689 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4792                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4793 0000168B 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4794                                  
  4795                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4796                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4797                                  ;
  4798                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4799                                  ;
  4800                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4801                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4802                                  
  4803 0000168D 50                      		push	ax
  4804 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
  4805 0000168F 51                      		push	cx
  4806 00001690 52                      		push	dx
  4807 00001691 57                      		push	di
  4808 00001692 06                      		push	es
  4809 00001693 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4810 00001695 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4811 00001697 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4812                                  					; DL = drive number
  4813                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4814                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4815                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4816 00001699 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4817                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4818                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4819                                  		; ds = cs
  4820 0000169B 8816[2D16]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4821                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4822 0000169F 07                      		pop	es
  4823 000016A0 5F                      		pop	di
  4824 000016A1 5A                      		pop	dx
  4825 000016A2 59                      		pop	cx
  4826 000016A3 5B                      		pop	bx
  4827 000016A4 58                      		pop	ax
  4828 000016A5 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4829                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4830                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4831                                  
  4832                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4833                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4834                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4835                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4836 000016A7 A0[2D16]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4837 000016AA 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4838 000016AC 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4839                                  
  4840                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4841                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4842 000016AE 48                      		dec	ax
  4843 000016AF EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4844                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4845                                  
  4846                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4847                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4848 000016B1 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4849 000016B4 A2[9D15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4850                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4851                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4852                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4853 000016B7 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4854                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4855                                  
  4856                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4857 000016B9 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4858 000016BB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4859                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4860                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4861                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4862 000016BD 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4863 000016BF 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4864 000016C1 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4865                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4866                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4867                                  		; ds = cs
  4868 000016C2 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4869                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4870                                  notsingle:				
  4871 000016C6 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4872                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4873                                  					; booted off hard file
  4874 000016C7 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4875                                  
  4876                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4877                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4878                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4879                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4880                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4881                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4882                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4883                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4884                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4885                                  
  4886                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4887                                  
  4888 000016C9 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4889 000016CC 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4890 000016CE 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4891                                  gothrd:					
  4892 000016D0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4893                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4894                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4895                                  					; ch = media byte
  4896 000016D2 FA                      		cli
  4897 000016D3 8ED2                    		mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer

  5238                                  
  5239                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5240                                  ; diskette drives:
  5241                                  ;
  5242                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5243                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5244                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5245                                  ;
  5246                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5247                                  ;
  5248                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5249                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5250                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5251                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5252                                  					
  5253 0000184B 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  5254

  5262                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5263                                  
  5264                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5265                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5266                                  
  5267                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5268                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5269                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5270                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5271                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5272                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5273                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5274                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5275                                  
  5276 00001855 803E[9D15]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1

  5278 0000185C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5279                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5280 0000185E 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5281                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5282 00001860 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5283 00001864 E90F01                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5571                                  ; than two diskette drives

  5574                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5575                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5576                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5577                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5591                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5592                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5593                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5594                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5595                                  ;
  5596                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5597                                  ;
  5598                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5599                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5600                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5601                                  ;use to start with.
  5602                                  ;
  5603                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5604                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5605                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5606                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5607                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5608

  5676                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5677                                  
  5678                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5679                                  ;
  5680                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5681                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5682                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5683                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5684                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5685                                  ; off of it.
  5686                                  ;
  5687                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5688                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5689                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5690                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5691                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5692                                  
  5693                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5694                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5695                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5696                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5697                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5698                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5699                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5700                                  
  5701                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5702 00001A1B 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5703                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5704 00001A22 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5705 00001A24 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5706                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'

  5984                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization

  5987                                  
  5988                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5989                                  
  5990                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5991                                  ; module name: remap
  5992                                  ;
  5993                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5994                                  ;
  5995                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5996                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5997                                  ;
  5998                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5999                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6000                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6001                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6002                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6003                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6004                                  
  6005                                  ; input:       none
  6006                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6007                                  ; exit error:  none
  6008                                  ; called from: msinit
  6009                                  ;
  6010                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6011                                  ;	  found in the system
  6012                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6013                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6014                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6015                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6016                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6017                                  ;
  6018                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6019                                  
  6020                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6021                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6022                                  
  6023                                  remap:		; proc near		
  6024 00001B14 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6025                                  
  6026                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6027                                  
  6028                                  drive_loop:				
  6029 00001B19 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6030                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6031 00001B1D 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6032 00001B1F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6033                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6034 00001B21 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6035 00001B24 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6036 00001B26 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6037                                  
  6038                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6039                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6040                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6041                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6042                                  
  6043                                  fdrv_found:				
  6044 00001B28 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6045                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6046 00001B2A 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6047                                  					; found	??
  6048 00001B2D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6049                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6050                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6051                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6052 00001B2F 40                      		inc	ax
  6053 00001B30 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6054 00001B33 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6055                                  
  6056                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6057                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6058                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6059                                  ; any more.
  6060                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6061                                  
  6062 00001B35 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6063                                  					; get first bds
  6064 00001B3A 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6065                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6066 00001B3C 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6067 00001B41 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6068                                  remap_loop1:				
  6069 00001B44 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6070                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6071 00001B46 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6072 00001B49 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6073 00001B4B FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6074 00001B4D 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6075                                  
  6076                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6077                                  
  6078 00001B4F 2EA0[8615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6079 00001B53 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6080 00001B55 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6081 00001B57 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6082 00001B5C 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6083                                  
  6084                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6085                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6086                                  
  6087 00001B5E 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6088 00001B60 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6089                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6090                                  
  6091                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6092                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6093                                  
  6094                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6095 00001B62 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6096                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6097 00001B67 2EA2[8615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6098 00001B6B FEC0                    		inc	al
  6099 00001B6D 1E                      		push	ds
  6100 00001B6E BF4504                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6101                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6102 00001B71 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6103 00001B73 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6104                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6105                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6106 00001B76 1F                      		pop	ds
  6107                                  rmap_exit:				
  6108 00001B77 C3                      		retn
  6109                                  
  6110                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6111                                  
  6112                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6113                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6114                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6115                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6116                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6117                                  ;**************************************************
  6118                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6119                                  ;
  6120                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6121                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6122                                  ;
  6123                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6124                                  ;**************************************************
  6125                                  
  6126                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6127                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6128                                  
  6129                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6130                                  		
  6131                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6132                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6133                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6134                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6135                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6136                                  
  6137 00001B78 2EA1[9115]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6138 00001B7C 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6139                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6140 00001B7E BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6141                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6142                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6143 00001B81 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6144 00001B84 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6145 00001B86 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6146 00001B89 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6147                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6148                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6149                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6150 00001B8B 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6151                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6152 00001B8D 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6153                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6154                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6155 00001B94 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6156                                  erret:					
  6157 00001B96 F9                      		stc
  6158                                  norm_ret:				
  6159 00001B97 C3                      		retn
  6160                                  
  6161                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6162                                  
  6163                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6164                                  
  6165                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6166                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6167                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6168                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6169                                  ;   determine version number
  6170                                  ;
  6171                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6172                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6173                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6174                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6175                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6176                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6177                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6178                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6179                                  
  6180                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6181                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6182                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6183 00001B98 57                      		push	di
  6184 00001B99 53                      		push	bx
  6185                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6186 00001B9A 06                      		push	es
  6187 00001B9B 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6188 00001B9E 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6189 00001BA1 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6190                                  					; fnon_removable
  6191 00001BA5 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6192                                  					; ffHardFile
  6193 00001BA9 C606[8E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6194 00001BAE 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6195 00001BB0 52                      		push	dx
  6196 00001BB1 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6197 00001BB3 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6198                                  					; DL = drive number
  6199                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6200                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6201                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6202 00001BB5 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6203 00001BB7 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6204 00001BBA 5A                      		pop	dx
  6205 00001BBB 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6206 00001BBD 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6207 00001BC0 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6208 00001BC3 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6209 00001BC4 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6210 00001BC7 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6211 00001BC8 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6212 00001BCA BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6213                                  
  6214                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6215                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6216                                  
  6217                                  act_part:
  6218 00001BCD 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6219 00001BD2 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6220 00001BD4 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6221 00001BD8 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6222 00001BDA 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6223 00001BDE 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6224 00001BE0 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6225 00001BE4 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6226                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6227 00001BE6 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6228                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6229 00001BE8 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6230 00001BEA FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6231                                  no_act:					
  6232 00001BEC 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6233 00001BEF 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6234                                  					; last entry done?
  6235 00001BF3 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6236 00001BF5 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6237                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6238                                  
  6239                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6240                                  
  6241                                  get_primary:
  6242 00001BF8 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6243 00001BFD 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6244                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6245 00001BFF 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6246 00001C03 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6247 00001C05 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6248 00001C09 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6249 00001C0B 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6250 00001C0F 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6251                                  got_prim:
  6252 00001C11 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6253 00001C13 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6254 00001C15 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6255                                  not_prim:
  6256 00001C17 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6257 00001C1A 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6258 00001C1E 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6259                                  setret:					
  6260 00001C20 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6261 00001C21 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6262                                  
  6263                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6264                                  
  6265                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6266                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6267                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6268                                  ;
  6269                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6270                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6271                                  ;  without change.
  6272                                  ;
  6273                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6274                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6275                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6276                                  
  6277                                  set2:		
  6278                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6279                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6280 00001C24 8816[9315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6281                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6282                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6283 00001C28 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6284 00001C2C 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6285                                  
  6286                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6287                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6288                                  
  6289 00001C30 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6290 00001C33 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6291 00001C36 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6292 00001C3A 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6293 00001C3E 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6294 00001C40 800E[8E15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6295                                  okdrive:
  6296 00001C45 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6297 00001C49 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6298                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6299 00001C4C 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6300 00001C50 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6301 00001C53 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6302 00001C57 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6303 00001C5B 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6304 00001C5E 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6305                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6306 00001C61 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6307 00001C64 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6308 00001C66 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6309 00001C69 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6310                                  okdrive_1:
  6311 00001C6B 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6312 00001C6E 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6313 00001C71 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6314                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6315 00001C73 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6316 00001C76 50                      		push	ax
  6317 00001C77 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6318 00001C79 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6319 00001C7B F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6320                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6321                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6322                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6323                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6324 00001C7D A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6325 00001C80 58                      		pop	ax
  6326 00001C81 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6327 00001C83 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6328 00001C85 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6329 00001C87 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6330 00001C89 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6331 00001C8C 50                      		push	ax
  6332 00001C8D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6333                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6334 00001C8F A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6335 00001C92 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6336                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6337 00001C94 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6338 00001C97 58                      		pop	ax
  6339 00001C98 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6340                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6341 00001C9A 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6342                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6343 00001C9F 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6344 00001CA1 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6345 00001CA4 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6346                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6347                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6348                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6349                                  okdrive_2:
  6350                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6351                                  ; dl is head.
  6352                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6353                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6354                                  
  6355                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6356                                  
  6357 00001CA6 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6358                                  					; check for mini disk
  6359 00001CAA 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6360 00001CAC 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6361                                  					; set the physical track number
  6362                                  oknotmini:
  6363                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6364                                  				
  6365 00001CAF D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6366 00001CB1 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6367 00001CB3 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6368 00001CB6 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6369 00001CB8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6370                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6371 00001CBA 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6372                                  		
  6373                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6374 00001CBC 8A16[9315]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6375                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6376                                  
  6377                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6378                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6379                                  ; dh is head
  6380                                  ; dl is drive
  6381                                  
  6382                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6383                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6384                                  
  6385                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6386                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6387                                  
  6388 00001CC0 0E                      		push	cs
  6389 00001CC1 07                      		pop	es
  6390 00001CC2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6391                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6392                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6393 00001CC5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6394 00001CC8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6395                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6396                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6397                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6398                                  
  6399                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6400                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6401                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6402                                  
  6403                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6404                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6405                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6406 00001CCA 53                      		push	bx
  6407 00001CCB 50                      		push	ax
  6408                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6409                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6410 00001CCC 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6411                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6412 00001CCF 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6413 00001CD1 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6414                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6415 00001CD4 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6416 00001CD6 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6417                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6418 00001CDA 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6419                                  check_1_ok:
  6420                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6421 00001CDC BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6422                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6423                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6424                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6425 00001CDF 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6426                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6427 00001CE2 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6428 00001CE4 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6429 00001CE6 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6430                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6431 00001CE8 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6432 00001CEC 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6433                                  
  6434                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6435 00001CEE 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6436                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6437                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6438                                  					; a power of 2
  6439                                  					;
  6440                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6441                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6442 00001CF1 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6443 00001CF3 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6444                                  
  6445                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6446 00001CF5 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6447 00001CF7 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6448 00001CF9 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6449                                  
  6450                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6451 00001CFB 58                      		pop	ax
  6452 00001CFC 5B                      		pop	bx
  6453 00001CFD E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6454                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6455                                  
  6456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6457                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6458                                  setret_brdg:
  6459 00001D00 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6460                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6461                                  
  6462                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6463 00001D03 E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6464                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6465                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6466                                  
  6467                                  valid_boot_record:
  6468 00001D06 58                      		pop	ax
  6469 00001D07 5B                      		pop	bx
  6470                                  
  6471                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6472                                  
  6473                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6474 00001D08 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6475                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6476                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6477 00001D0D 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  6478 00001D0F 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  6479                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6480                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6481                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6482                                  		;jnz	short try5
  6483                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  6484 00001D13 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  6485

  6962                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6963                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)

  6965                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6966                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6967                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  6968                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  6969                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  6970                                  		;} else {
  6971                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);

  6973                                  		;}

  6979

  6983                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
