  9544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9545                                  
  9546                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9547                                  
  9548                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9549                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9550                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9551                                  ;
  9552                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9553                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9554                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9555                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9556                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9557                                  ;
  9558                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9559                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9560                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9562                                  
  9563                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9564 000004D1 E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9565 000004D4 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9566                                  
  9567                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9568                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9569                                  ;
  9570                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9571                                  ;	       ----------------
  9572                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9573                                  ;
  9574                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9575                                  ;
  9576                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9577                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9578                                  ;		1,193,180
  9579                                  ;
  9580                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9581                                  ;
  9582                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9583                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9584                                  ;		59,659
  9585                                  ;
  9586                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9587                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9588                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9589                                  ;
  9590                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9591                                  ; multiply by 5
  9592                                  
  9593 000004D8 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9594 000004DA 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9595                                  					; multiply by 5
  9596 000004DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9597 000004DE D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9598 000004E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9599 000004E2 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9600 000004E4 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9601 000004E6 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9602 000004E8 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9603                                  
  9604                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9605                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9606                                  
  9607 000004E9 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9608 000004EC F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9609                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9610                                  
  9611                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9612                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9613 000004EE 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9614 000004EF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9615 000004F1 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9616                                  
  9617                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9618                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9619                                  
  9620 000004F3 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9621 000004F5 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9622                                  
  9623                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9624                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9625                                  
  9626 000004F8 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9627 000004FA 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9628 000004FD 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9629 000004FF 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9630                                  noadj:					
  9631 00000502 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9632 00000503 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9633                                  
  9634                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9635                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9636                                  
  9637 00000505 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9638 00000507 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9639 00000509 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9640 0000050B B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9641 0000050E F7F1                    		div	cx
  9642 00000510 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9643 00000512 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9644 00000514 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9645                                  
  9646                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9647                                  
  9648                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9649                                  		;push	ax
  9650                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9651 00000516 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9652 00000517 AB                      		stosw
  9653                                  		;pop	ax
  9654 00000518 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9655 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9656 0000051A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9657 0000051C AB                      		stosw
  9658 0000051D F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9659                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9660                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9661                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9662                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9663 0000051E C3                      		retn
  9664                                  
  9665                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9666                                  
  9667                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9668                                  
  9669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9670                                  ;
  9671                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9672                                  ;
  9673                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9674                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9675                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9676                                  ;
  9677                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9678                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9679                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9680                                  ;			else
  9681                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9682                                  ;		}
  9683                                  ;
  9684                                  ; USES : AX
  9685                                  ;
  9686                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9687                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9688                                  ;
  9689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9690                                  
  9691                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9692                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9693 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9694 00000521 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9695                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9696                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9697                                  					; midnight
  9698                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9699 00000523 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9700 00000528 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9701 0000052A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9702                                  					; and not flag
  9703 0000052C 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9704 00000530 C3                      		retn
  9705                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9706                                  
  9707                                  inc_case:				
  9708 00000531 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9709 00000533 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9710 00000535 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9711                                  no_rollover:				
  9712 00000539 C3                      		retn
  9713

  9741                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9742                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9743                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9744                                  
  9745                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9746                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9747                                  
  9748                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9749                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9750                                  
  9751                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9752                                  
  9753                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9754                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9755                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9756                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9757                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9758                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9759                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9760                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9761                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9762                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9763                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9764                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9765                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9766                                  
  9767                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9768                                  
  9769                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9770                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9771                                  ;
  9772                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9773                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9774                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9775                                  ;   else
  9776                                  ;	set slow = value
  9777                                  ;   ...
  9778                                  ;*********************************************
  9779                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9780                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9781                                  ;*	 use slow
  9782                                  ;*   else
  9783                                  ;*	 use fast
  9784                                  ;*********************************************
  9785                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9786                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9787                                  ;	use slow
  9788                                  ;   else
  9789                                  ;	use fast
  9790                                  ;   ...
  9791                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9792                                  ;
  9793                                  ;
  9794                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9795                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9796                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9797                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9798                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9799                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9800                                  
  9801                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9802                                  
  9803                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9804                                  
  9805                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9806                                  
  9807                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9808                                  ;	command jump table
  9809                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9810                                  
  9811 0000053A 00                      		db 0
  9812                                  
  9813                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9814                                  %if 0
  9815                                  
  9816                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9817                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9818                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9819                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk

  9881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9882                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9883                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9884                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9885                                  ;
  9886                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9888                                  
  9889                                  SetDrive:	
  9890                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9891 00000570 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9892                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9893 00000574 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9894 00000578 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9895 0000057A 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9896 0000057D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9897 00000580 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9898 00000582 F9                      		stc

  9900 00000583 C3                      		retn

  9902                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9903                                  
  9904                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9905                                  
  9906                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9907                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9908                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9909                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9910                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------

  9913                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh

  9916 0000058A 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9917                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9918 0000058F 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9919                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9920 00000591 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format

  9922                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag

  9924                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9925 0000059B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9926                                  					; fnon_removable
  9927 000005A0 740B                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy

  9929                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9930 000005A2 F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
  9931 000005A4 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9932                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9933                                  
  9934                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9935                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9936 000005A6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9937 000005AB 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9938                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9939                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
  9940                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9941 000005AD 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
  9942                                  
  9943                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9944                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9945                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9946                                  
  9947 000005AE 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9948 000005B3 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not

  9995                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9996                                  
  9997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9998                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9999                                  ; drive.
 10000                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10001                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10002                                  ; returns in si:
 10003                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10004                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10005                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10006                                  ;
 10007                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10009                                  
 10010                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10011                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10012 000005F6 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10013 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10014 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10015                                  					; get stored time
 10016 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10017 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10018 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10019                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10020                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10021                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10022 00000608 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10023 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10024 0000060C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10025                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10026                                  		;inc	al
 10027                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10028                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10029                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10030                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10031                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10032                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10033                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10034                                  		;dec	al
 10035                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10036                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10037 0000060E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10038 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10039 00000615 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10040 00000619 C3                      		retn
 10041                                  
 10042                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10043                                  
 10044                                  timepassed:
 10045 0000061A 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10046                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10047 0000061D 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10048                                  
 10049                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10050                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10051 0000061F 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10052                                  timecheck_ret:
 10053                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10054                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10055 00000620 C3                      		retn
 10056

 10058                                  ; 15/10/2022

 10131                                  
 10132                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10133                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10134                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10135                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10136                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10137                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10138                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10139                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10140                                  ;
 10141                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10142                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10143                                  
 10144                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10145                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10146                                  
 10147                                  ; 11/09/2023
 10148                                  ; 14/08/2023
 10149                                  ;BDS.fatsiz equ 1Fh
 10150                                  
 10151                                  clear_ids:
 10152                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 10153 0000066A 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 10154                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10155                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10156 0000066E 57                      		push	di
 10157 0000066F 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10158 00000671 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10159 00000675 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10160                                  
 10161                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10162                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10163                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10164                                  
 10165                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10166                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10167 00000679 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 10168                                  
 10169                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10170 0000067B BE[1505]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10171 0000067E 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10172 00000681 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10173                                  		
 10174                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10175                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10176                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10177                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10178                                  
 10179                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10180                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10181                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10182                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10183                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10184                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10185                                  			;
 10186                                  			; Correct Code:
 10187                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10188                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10189                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10190                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10191                                  			;
 10192                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10193                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10194                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10195                                  			;
 10196                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10197                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10198                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10199                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10200                                  
 10201 00000683 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10202                                  		
 10203                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10204 00000685 BE[0C05]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
 10205 00000688 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
 10206                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
 10207 0000068A BE[0305]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 10208                                  ci_bigfat:				
 10209                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10210                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10211 0000068D B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 10212 0000068F 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10213                                  					; filesys_id field
 10214 00000692 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10215 00000694 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 10216 00000695 C3                      		retn

 10220                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10221                                  
 10222                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10223                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10224                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10225                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10226                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10227                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10228                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10229                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10230                                  ;
 10231                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10232                                  ;
 10233                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10234                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10235                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10236                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10237                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10238                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10239                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10240                                  ;
 10241                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10242                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.

 10411                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10412                                  
 10413                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10414                                  
 10415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10416                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10417                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10418                                  ;
 10419                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10421                                  
 10422                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10423                                  
 10424                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10425                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10426                                  
 10427                                  readbootsec:	
 10428 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10429 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10430 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10431 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10432 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10433                                  
 10434                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10435                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10436                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10437                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10438                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10439                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10440                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10441                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10442                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10443                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10444                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10445                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10446                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10447                                  		; informations
 10448                                  
 10449                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10450                                  
 10451                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10452                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10453                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10454                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10455                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10456                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10457                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10458                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10459                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10460                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10461                                  
 10462                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10463 0000075B A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10464 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10465 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10466                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10467 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10468 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10469                                  					; no need for nop
 10470 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10471 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10472 0000076A 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10473 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10474                                  
 10475                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10476                                  ;
 10477                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10478                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10479                                  ;;
 10480                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10481                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10482                                  ;;
 10483                                  ;;check_signature:
 10484                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10485                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10486                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10487                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10488                                  
 10489                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10490                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10491                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10492                                  
 10493                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10494                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10495 00000771 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10496                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10497 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10498 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10499 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10500 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10501 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10502                                  
 10503                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10504                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10505                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10506                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10507                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10508                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10509                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10510                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10511                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10512                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10513                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10514                                  
 10515                                  checksinglesided:
 10516                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10517                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10518                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10519 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10520 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10521 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10522 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10523 00000784 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10524 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10525 0000078C 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10526 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10527                                  
 10528                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10529                                  
 10530                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10531 00000793 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10532                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10533 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10535                                  
 10536                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10537 0000079A 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10538                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10539                                  movbpb_ret:
 10540                                  gooddsk:				
 10541 0000079B F8                      		clc
 10542                                  err_ret:
 10543 0000079C C3                      		retn

 10545

 10550                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10551                                  
 10552                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10554                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10555                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10556                                  ;
 10557                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10558                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10559                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10560                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10561                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10562                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10563                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10564                                  
 10565                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10566                                  
 10567                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10568                                  movbpb:	
 10569 0000079D 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10570                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10571                                  					; sectors per unit
 10572 000007A1 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10573                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10574                                  					; number of directory entries
 10575 000007A5 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10576                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10577                                  					; size of drive
 10578 000007A9 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10579                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10580                                  					; media	descriptor
 10581 000007AD A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10582                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10583                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10584 000007B0 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10585                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10586                                  					; sectors per track
 10587 000007B4 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10588                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10589                                  					; number of heads
 10590 000007B8 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10591 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10592 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10593 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10594 000007C4 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10595                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10596 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10597 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10598 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10599                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10600                                  		; cf = 0
 10601                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10602                                  		;clc
 10603 000007D3 C3                      		retn
 10604                                  
 10605                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10606                                  
 10607                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10608                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10609                                  ;by es:di.
 10610                                  
 10611                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10612                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10613                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10614                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10615                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10616                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10617                                  
 10618                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10619                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10620 000007D4 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10621                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10622                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10623 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10624 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 10625 000007DC 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10626                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10627 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10628 000007E4 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10629                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10630 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10631 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 10632 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 10633 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10634 000007F1 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh

 10661                                  
 10662                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10663                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10664                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10665                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10666                                  ; output:
 10667                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10668                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10669                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10670                                  
 10671                                  readfat:	
 10672                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10673                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10674 00000809 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10675 0000080B B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10676                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10677 0000080E E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10678 00000811 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10679 00000813 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10680                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10681 00000815 C3                      		retn
 10682                                  
 10683                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10684                                  
 10685                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10686                                  
 10687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10688                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10689                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10690                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10691                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10692                                  ;		dh has head
 10693                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10694                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10695                                  ;
 10696                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10697                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10698                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10699                                  ;
 10700                                  ;		carry set
 10701                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10702                                  ;
 10703                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10704                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10705                                  
 10706                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10707                                  
 10708                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10709                                  read_sector:	
 10710 00000816 55                      		push	bp
 10711 00000817 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10712 0000081A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10713 0000081E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10714                                  rd_ret:					
 10715 00000821 06                      		push	es
 10716 00000822 1E                      		push	ds
 10717 00000823 07                      		pop	es
 10718 00000824 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10719 00000827 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10720                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10721                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10722                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10723 00000829 07                      		pop	es
 10724 0000082A 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10725                                  rd_rty:					
 10726 0000082C E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10727 0000082F 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10728 00000831 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10729                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10730                                  					; fnon_removable
 10731 00000836 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10732 00000838 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10733 0000083D 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10734 0000083F 50                      		push	ax
 10735 00000840 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10736 00000841 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10737                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10738                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10739                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10740                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10741 00000845 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10742 00000847 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10743                                  		; 
 10744 0000084A 1F                      		pop	ds
 10745 0000084B A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10746 0000084E 58                      		pop	ax
 10747                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10748 0000084F 06                      		push	es
 10749 00000850 1E                      		push	ds
 10750 00000851 07                      		pop	es
 10751 00000852 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10752 00000855 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10753                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10754                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10755                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10756 00000857 07                      		pop	es
 10757 00000858 9C                      		pushf
 10758 00000859 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10759 0000085E 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10760 00000860 50                      		push	ax
 10761 00000861 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10762 00000864 1E                      		push	ds
 10763 00000865 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10764 00000869 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10765 0000086C 1F                      		pop	ds
 10766 0000086D 58                      		pop	ax
 10767                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10768 0000086E 9D                      		popf
 10769 0000086F 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10770 00000871 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10772                                  
 10773                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10774 00000873 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10775                                  					; return error
 10776 00000875 F9                      		stc
 10777                                  
 10778                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10779                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10780                                  
 10781                                  okret2:					
 10782 00000876 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10783 0000087A 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10784 0000087E 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10785                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10786                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred

 10789 00000886 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10790 00000887 5D                      		pop	bp
 10791 00000888 C3                      		retn

 10817                                  exitjx:					
 10818                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10819                                  		; cf = 0
 10820                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10821                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10822 000008AD C3                      		retn

 10881                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10882                                  
 10883                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10884                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10885                                  
 10886                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10887                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10888                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10889                                  
 10890                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10891                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10892                                  ;
 10893                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10894                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10895                                  
 10896                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10897                                  checksingle:		
 10898 000008D8 50                      		push	ax
 10899 000008D9 53                      		push	bx
 10900 000008DA 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10901                                  
 10902                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10903                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10904                                  
 10905 000008DE F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10906 000008E1 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10907 000008E3 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10908                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10909 000008E6 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10910                                  
 10911                                  
 10912                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10913                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10914                                  
 10915 000008E8 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10916                                  					; get physical drive number
 10917 000008EC 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10918 000008ED 57                      		push	di
 10919 000008EE C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10920                                  scan_list:				
 10921 000008F2 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10922 000008F6 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10923 000008F8 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10924 000008FA 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10925 000008FE 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10926 00000900 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10927 00000904 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10928 00000905 07                      		pop	es
 10929 00000906 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10930                                  
 10931                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10932                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10933                                  ; in this case.
 10934 0000090A 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10935 0000090F 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10936                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10937 00000911 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10938 00000916 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10939 00000918 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10940                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10941                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10942 0000091C 06                      		push	es
 10943 0000091D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10944 00000921 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10945                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10946                                  					; set up sdsb
 10947 00000925 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10948 00000926 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10949                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10950                                  
 10951                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10952                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10953                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10954                                  
 10955                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10956 00000928 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10957 0000092D 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10958 0000092F 50                      		push	ax
 10959 00000930 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10960 00000934 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10961 00000936 06                      		push	es
 10962 00000937 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10963 0000093B 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10964                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10965                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10966 00000940 07                      		pop	es
 10967 00000941 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10968 00000943 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10969 00000944 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10970                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10971 00000946 E8690E                  		call	swpdsk
 10972 00000949 EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10973                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10974                                  
 10975                                  scan_skip:	
 10976 0000094B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]

 10978                                  					; go to	next bds
 10979 0000094E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10980 00000951 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10981 00000953 F9                      		stc
 10982 00000954 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10983 00000955 07                      		pop	es

 11006                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11007                                  
 11008                                  ; 15/10/52022
 11009                                  
 11010                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11011                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11012                                  ;
 11013                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11014                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11015                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11016                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11017                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11018                                  ;	ds = cs
 11019                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11020                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11021                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11022                                  ;
 11023                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 11024                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 11025                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11026                                  
 11027                                  diskrd:	
 11028                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 11029                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11030 00000961 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 11031                                  
 11032                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11033                                  
 11034                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11035                                  diskio:
 11036 00000966 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 11037 00000968 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 11038 0000096C E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 11039 0000096F 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 11040 00000973 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 11041                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 11042 00000976 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 11043                                  
 11044                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 11045                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11046                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11047                                  
 11048 00000978 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11049                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11050                                  					; unformatted_media
 11051 0000097D 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11052 0000097F 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11053 00000983 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11054                                  
 11055                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11056                                  
 11057 00000987 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11058 00000989 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 11059 0000098B 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 11060                                  		;adc	si, 0
 11061                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11062 0000098D D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 11063 0000098F 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11064                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 11065 00000994 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 11066                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 11067                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11068 00000996 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11069 00000998 75BF                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11070 0000099A 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11071 0000099E 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 11072 000009A0 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 11073                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11074                                  
 11075                                  sanity32:				
 11076 000009A2 0336[2305]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 11077 000009A6 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 11078 000009AA 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 11079 000009AC 77AB                    		ja	short baddrive
 11080 000009AE 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 11081 000009B2 77A5                    		ja	short baddrive
 11082                                  
 11083                                  sanityok:

 11480                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 11481                                  
 11482                                  doverify:

 11487 00000BC2 73A5                    		jnb	short noverify
 11488                                  
 11489                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 11490                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft
 11491                                  ; ecc error then decrement the soft_ecc_cnt error retry count. if
 11492                                  ; this retry count becomes 0 then we just ignore the error and go to
