 13288                                  
 13289                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13290                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 13291                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13292                                  ;
 13293                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 13294                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 13295                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 13296                                  ; history in the flags.
 13297                                  ;
 13298                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 13299                                  ;
 13300                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 13301                                  ;
 13302                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 13303                                  ;
 13304                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 13305                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 13306                                  ;
 13307                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13308                                  
 13309                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 13310 0000128A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13311 0000128E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 13312 00001290 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 13313                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13314 00001292 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 13315                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13316                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 13317 00001297 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13318 00001299 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 13319 0000129E 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13320 000012A0 E8EB06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 13321 000012A3 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 13322                                  
 13323                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 13324                                  
 13325 000012A5 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 13326 000012A7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 13327                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 13328                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 13329 000012A9 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13330 000012AB 53                      		push	bx
 13331 000012AC BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13332                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 13333                                  					; physical drive
 13334 000012AF E8B506                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13335 000012B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13336                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 13337 000012B3 C3                      		retn
 13338                                  
 13339                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13340                                  
 13341                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13342                                  
 13343                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13344                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 13345                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13346                                  ;
 13347                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13348                                  ;
 13349                                  ; INPUT :
 13350                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13351                                  ;
 13352                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 13353                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 13354                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13355                                  
 13356                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13357                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 13358 000012B4 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 13359 000012B8 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13360                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 13361                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13362 000012BB 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 13363                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13364 000012BD 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13365                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13366                                  					; unformatted_media
 13367 000012C2 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 13368 000012C4 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 13369                                  
 13370                                  GafDone:				
 13371 000012C6 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13372 000012C9 C3                      		retn
 13373                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13374                                  
 13375                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13376                                  
 13377                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13378                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 13379                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13380                                  ;
 13381                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13382                                  ;
 13383                                  ; input :
 13384                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13385                                  ;
 13386                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 13387                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13388                                  
 13389                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13390                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 13391 000012CA C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 13392 000012CE C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13393                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13394 000012D1 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 13395                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13396                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 13397 000012D6 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13398 000012DA 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 13399                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13400 000012DC 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13401                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13402                                  					; unformatted_media
 13403                                  saf_Done:				
 13404 000012E1 C3                      		retn
 13405                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13406                                  
 13407                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13408                                  
 13409                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13410                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13411                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13412                                  ;
 13413                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13414                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13415                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13416                                  ;
 13417                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13418                                  
 13419                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13420                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13421 000012E2 06                      		push	es
 13422 000012E3 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13423 000012E7 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13424                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13425                                  
 13426                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13427                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 13428                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 13429                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 13430                                  
 13431 000012EB 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13432                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13433 000012ED 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13434                                  ioctl_support:
 13435 000012EF 0E                      		push	cs
 13436 000012F0 07                      		pop	es
 13437                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13438                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13439 000012F1 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13440                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13441 000012F4 BF[D50C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13442                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13443                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13444 000012F7 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13445 000012F9 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13446 000012FB 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13447 000012FD B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13448                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13449                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13450                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13451                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13452                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13454                                  ioctlsupexit:
 13455 00001300 07                      		pop	es
 13456                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13457                                  		; cf = 0
 13458                                  		;clc
 13459 00001301 C3                      		retn
 13460                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13461                                  nosupport:
 13462 00001302 07                      		pop	es
 13463 00001303 E9D3ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13465                                  
 13466                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13467                                  
 13468                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13469                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13470                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13471                                  ;
 13472                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13473                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13474                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13475                                  ;	    drive)
 13476                                  ;
 13477                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13478                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13479                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13480                                  ;
 13481                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13482                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13483                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13484                                  ;
 13485                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13486                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13487                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13488                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13489                                  ;
 13490                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13491                                  ;
 13492                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13493                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13494                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13495                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13496                                  ; 
 13497                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13498                                  
 13499                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13500                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13501 00001306 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13502 0000130A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13503                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13504                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13505 0000130D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13506 0000130F 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13507                                  		;
 13508 00001311 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13509                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13510                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13511                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13512 00001315 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13513                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13514 00001317 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13515 00001319 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13516 0000131B FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13517                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13518 0000131D FEC8                    		dec	al
 13519 0000131F 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13520 00001321 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13521 00001323 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13522 00001325 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13523 00001327 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13524 00001329 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13525 0000132B 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13526                                  GotMediaType:				
 13527 0000132D 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13528                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13529                                  		; cf = 0
 13530                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13531 00001330 C3                      		retn
 13532                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13533                                  
 13534                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13535 00001331 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13536 00001334 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13537 00001336 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13538 00001338 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13539 0000133B 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13540                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13541 0000133D B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13542                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13543 0000133F B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13544 00001341 F9                      		stc
 13545 00001342 C3                      		retn
 13546                                  
 13547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13548                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13549                                  		;db    0
 13550                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13551                                  
 13552                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13553                                  
 13554                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13555                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13556                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13557                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13558                                  
 13559                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13560                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13561                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13562                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13563                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13564                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13565                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13566                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13567                                  ;
 13568                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13569                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13570                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13571                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13572                                  ;
 13573                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13574                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13575                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13576                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13577                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13578                                  ;
 13579                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13580                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13581                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13582                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13583                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13584                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13585                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13586                                  
 13587                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13588                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13589                                  
 13590                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13591                                  
 13592                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13593 00001343 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13594 00001346 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13595 00001348 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13596 0000134B 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13597                                  
 13598                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13599                                  
 13600 0000134D 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13601 00001350 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13602 00001352 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13603 00001355 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13604 00001357 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13605                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13606                                  
 13607                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13608 0000135A CF                      		iret
 13609                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13610                                  
 13611                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13612 0000135B 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13613 0000135C 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13614                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13615                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13616                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13617 0000135E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13618                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13619                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13620                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13621                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13622                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13623                                  		
 13624                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13625                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13626 00001363 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13627                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13628 00001367 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13629                                  
 13630                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13631                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13632                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13633                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13634                                  		
 13635                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13636                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13637 0000136B 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13638 0000136F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13639                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13640                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13641 00001372 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13642 00001376 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13643                                  
 13644 0000137A 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13645                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13646                                  		;pop	bx
 13647 0000137B 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13648                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13649 0000137C 58                      		pop	ax
 13650                                  i2f_iret:
 13651 0000137D CF                      		iret
 13652                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13653                                  
 13654                                  mine:
 13655 0000137E 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13656 00001380 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13657 00001382 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13658 00001384 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13659 00001386 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13660                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13661                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13662 00001388 CF                      		iret
 13663                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13664                                  
 13665                                  disp_func:
 13666 00001389 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13667 0000138B 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13668 0000138D 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13669 0000138F 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13670                                  
 13671                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13672                                  
 13673 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13674 00001392 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13675                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13676                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13677                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13678                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13679                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13680 00001397 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13681 0000139B 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13682 0000139F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13683                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13684                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 13685                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1708h
 13686 000013A0 EA[1907]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry ; BIOSDATA:dsk_entry
 13687                                  		;; 17/10/2022
 13688                                  		;;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 13689                                  		;jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13690                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13691                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13692                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13693                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13694                                  
 13695                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13696                                  
 13697                                  do_subfun_01:
 13698 000013A5 06                      		push	es
 13699 000013A6 1E                      		push	ds
 13700 000013A7 1E                      		push	ds
 13701 000013A8 07                      		pop	es
 13702                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13703 000013A9 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 13704                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13705                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13706 000013AE E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 13707 000013B1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13708 000013B2 07                      		pop	es
 13709                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13710                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13711 000013B3 CF                      		iret
 13712                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13713                                  
 13714                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13715                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13716 000013B4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13717                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13718 000013B9 C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13719                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13720                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13721                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13722                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13723 000013BD CF                      		iret
 13724                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13725                                  
 13726                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13727                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13728                                  
 13729                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13730                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13731                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13732                                  
 13733                                  win386call:				
 13734 000013BE 1E                      		push	ds
 13735 000013BF 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13736                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13737                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h

 13739                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?

 13742                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13743 000013CA 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13744                                  		; 12/12/2022

 13748                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13749 000013D1 8026[6F08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13750 000013D6 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret

 13757 000013DB 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue

 13776                                  handle_multmult:

 13781                                  		; 10/12/2022

 13783                                  		;dec	bx

 13785 000013FC 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA

 13787 00001400 F7D3                    		not	bx

 13799 00001409 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13800 0000140B 7530                    		jnz	short try_3

 13802                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13803                                  		;xor	di, di
 13804                                  		;dec	di

 13851                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13852                                  
 13853                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13854                                  ;
 13855                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13856                                  ;
 13857                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13858                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13859                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13860                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13861                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13862                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13863                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13864                                  ;
 13865                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13866                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13867                                  ;
 13868                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13869                                  
 13870                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13871                                  HMAPtr:
 13872 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13873                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13874 00001443 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13875                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13876 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13877 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13878 0000144C 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13879                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13880 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13881 00001453 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13882                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13883 00001457 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13884                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13885                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13886 0000145B C3                      		retn
 13887                                  
 13888                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13889                                  
 13890                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13891                                  
 13892                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13893                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13894                                  
 13895                                  move_sector:
 13896                                  
 13897                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13898                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13899                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13900                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13901                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13902                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13903                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13904                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13905                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13906                                  ;
 13907                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13908                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13909                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13910                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13911                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13912                                  
 13913 0000145C FC                      		cld
 13914 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 13915 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13916 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13917 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13918 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13919 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13920 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13921 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 13922 00001470 C3                      		retn
 13923                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13924                                  
 13925                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13926 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13927 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13928 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 13929 00001476 C3                      		retn
 13930                                  
 13931                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13932                                  
 13933                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13934                                  
 13935                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13936                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13937                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13938                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13939                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13940                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13941                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13942                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13943                                  ;
 13944                                  ; input conditions:
 13945                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13946                                  ;
 13947                                  ; output:
 13948                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13949                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13950                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13951                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13952                                  
 13953                                  check_wrap:	
 13954 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 13955 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 13956 00001479 06                      		push	es
 13957 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 13958 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13959 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13960                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13961 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13962                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13963 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13964 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13965 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13966 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13967 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13968 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13969 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13970                                  
 13971                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13972                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13973                                  
 13974 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13975 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13976                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13977 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13978 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13979                                  					; if on	boundary
 13980                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13981                                  not_on_bound:
 13982 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13983 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13984 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13985 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 13986 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13987 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13988                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13989 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13990 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13991                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13992                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13993 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13994 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13995 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13996                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13997 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13998                                  
 13999                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14000                                  
 14001 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14002 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14003 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14004                                  
 14005                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14006                                  
 14007 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14008 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14009 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14010                                  no_head_bound:				
 14011 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14012 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14013 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14014 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14015 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14016 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14017 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14018 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14019 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14020 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14021 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14022 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14023 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14024 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14025                                  no_wrap:				
 14026 000014DE F8                      		clc
 14027 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 14028 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 14029 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14030 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 14031 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 14032                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14033                                  
 14034                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14035 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14036 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14037 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14038                                  
 14039                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14040                                  
 14041                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14042                                  
 14043                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14044                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14045                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14046                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14047                                  ;
 14048                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14049                                  
 14050                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14051                                  find_bds:	
 14052 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14053                                  fbds_1:					
 14054 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14055 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14056 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14057                                  					; go to next bds
 14058 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14059 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14060 000014FC F9                      		stc
 14061                                  fdbs_2:					
 14062 000014FD C3                      		retn
 14063                                  
 14064                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14065                                  
 14066                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14067                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14068                                  doint:
 14069                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14070 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14071                                  					; get physical drive number
 14072                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14073                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14074                                  		
 14075 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14076 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14077 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14078                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14079 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14080                                  					; get request code
 14081                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14082 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14083                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14084 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 14085                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14086                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14087 0000150E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14088                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14089                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14090 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 14091                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14092 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14093                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14094                                  dointdone:				
 14095 00001517 C3                      		retn
 14096                                  
 14097                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14098                                  
 14099                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14100                                  
 14101                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14102                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14103                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14104                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14105                                  ;
 14106                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14107                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14108                                  ;
 14109                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14110                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14111                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14112                                  
 14113                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14114                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14115                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14116                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14117                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14118                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14119                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14120                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14121                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14122                                  ;end struc
 14123                                  
 14124                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14125                                  
 14126                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14127                                  ;	ah = function
 14128                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14129                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14130                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14131                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14132                                  ;   output conditions:
 14133                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14134                                  
 14135                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14136                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14137                                  ;
 14138                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14139                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14140                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14141                                  
 14142                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14143                                  
 14144                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14145                                  
 14146 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14147                                  
 14148                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14149                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14150                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14151                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14152                                  
 14153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14154                                  
 14155                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14156                                  
 14157                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14158                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14159                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14160                                  
 14161                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14162 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14163 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14164 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 14165 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14166 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14167 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14168 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14170                                  
 14171                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14172                                  
 14173                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14174                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14175                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14176                                  
 14177                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14178                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14179 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14180 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14181 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14182 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 14183 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14184 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14185 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14186 00001539 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14187 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 14188 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 14189 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14190                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14191 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14192 00001542 06                      		push	es
 14193                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14194 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14195                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14196                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
