 20229                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20230                                  
 20231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20232                                  ;
 20233                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20234                                  ;
 20235                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20236                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20237                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20238                                  ;
 20239                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20240                                  ;
 20241                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20242                                  
 20243                                  AllocHMA:
 20244                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20245                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20246                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20247                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20248                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20249                                  
 20250                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20251                                  ;
 20252                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20253                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20254                                  ;	push	ax
 20255                                  ;	popf
 20256                                  ;	pushf
 20257                                  ;	pop	ax
 20258                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20259                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20260                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20261                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20262                                  
 20263                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20264                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20265                                  
 20266 00000A60 1E                      	push	ds
 20267                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20268                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20269                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20270 00000A61 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20271 00000A64 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20272                                  
 20273 00000A66 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20274 00000A69 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20275                                  
 20276 00000A6B B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20277 00000A6E CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20278                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20279                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20280                                  
 20281 00000A70 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20282                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 20283 00000A74 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20284                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20285                                  
 20286 00000A78 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20287 00000A7A BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20288                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh

 20401                                  
 20402                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20403                                  ;
 20404                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20405                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20406                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20407                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20408                                  ;
 20409                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20410                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20411                                  ;
 20412                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20413                                  
 20414                                  StartVDHead:
 20415                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20416                                  
 20417 00000AD8 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20418 00000ADC 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20419 00000ADE 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20420 00000AE0 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20421 00000AE2 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20422                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20423 00000AE3 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20424                                  VDiskSig1:
 20425 00000AEA 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20426                                  
 20427                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20428                                  
 20429 00000AEF 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20430                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20431 00000AF5 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20432 00000B04 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20433 00000B06 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20434                                  VDInt19:
 20435 00000B07 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20436                                  OldVDInt19:
 20437 00000B08 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20438                                  
 20439                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20440                                  
 20441                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20442 00000B0C 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20443                                  VDiskSig2:
 20444 00000B0F 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20445                                  
 20446                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20447                                  
 20448 00000B14 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20449 00000B17 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20450 00000B19 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20451 00000B1A 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20452 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20453 00000B1D 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20454 00000B1F 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20455 00000B21 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20456 00000B22 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20457 00000B24 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20458 00000B26 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20459 00000B28 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20460 00000B2A 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20461                                  
 20462                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20463                                  
 20464                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20465                                  ;
 20466                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20467                                  ;
 20468                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20469                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20470                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20471                                  ;
 20472                                  ; Inputs : None
 20473                                  ;
 20474                                  ; Outputs : None
 20475                                  ;
 20476                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20477                                  ;
 20478                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20479                                  
 20480                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20481                                  
 20482                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20483 00000B2C 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20484 00000B2E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20485                                  
 20486                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20487                                  
 20488                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20489 00000B30 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20490                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20491 00000B33 2EA3[080B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20492 00000B37 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20493                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20494 00000B3A 2EA3[0A0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20495                                  
 20496                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20497                                  
 20498 00000B3E B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20499                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20500                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20501 00000B40 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20502 00000B43 CD21                    	int	21h
 20503                                  
 20504                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20505                                  
 20506 00000B45 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20507 00000B46 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20508                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20509 00000B48 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20510                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20511 00000B4F 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20512 00000B56 40                      	inc	ax
 20513 00000B57 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20514                                  
 20515                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20516                                  
 20517 00000B59 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20518                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20519 00000B5A C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20520 00000B60 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20521                                  
 20522                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20523                                  
 20524                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20525 00000B63 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20526 00000B66 BE[D80A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20527 00000B69 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20528 00000B6B 0E                      	push	cs
 20529 00000B6C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20530 00000B6D FC                      	cld
 20531 00000B6E F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20532 00000B70 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20533                                  
 20534                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20535                                  
 20536                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20537 00000B71 57                      	push	di
 20538 00000B72 06                      	push	es
 20539                                  
 20540                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20541                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20542                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20543 00000B73 49                      	dec	cx
 20544                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20545 00000B74 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20546                                  
 20547 00000B76 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20548                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20549 00000B79 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20550 00000B7C BE[0C0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20551 00000B7F F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20552                                  
 20553 00000B81 5F                      	pop	di
 20554 00000B82 07                      	pop	es
 20555                                  
 20556 00000B83 C3                      	retn
 20557                                  
 20558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20559                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20560                                  ;
 20561                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20562                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20563                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20564                                  ;
 20565                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20566                                  
 20567                                  struc desc
 20568 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20569 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20570 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 20571 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 20572 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 20573                                   .size:

 20577                                  bmove:		;label byte
 20578

 20580 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0

 20582 00000B8C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20583 00000B94 FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 20584 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0
 20585 00000B98 00                      		db	0
 20586 00000B99 93                      		db	93h
 20587 00000B9A 0000                    		dw	0
 20588 00000B9C FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 20589 00000B9E 0000                    		dw	0
 20590 00000BA0 10                      		db	10h
 20591 00000BA1 93                      		db	93h
 20592 00000BA2 0000                    		dw	0
 20593                                  
 20594                                  rombios_code:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20595 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20596                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20597 00000BAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20598                                  
 20599 00000BB4 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20600                                  
 20601                                  
 20602                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20603                                  
 20604                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20605                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20606                                  
 20607                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20608                                  
 20609                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20610                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20611                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20612                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20613                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20614                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20615                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20616                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20617                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20618                                  ;								      ;I070
 20619                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20620                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20621                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20622                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20623                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20624                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20625                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20626                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20627                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20628                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20629                                  ;								      ;I070
 20630                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20631                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20632                                  
 20633                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20634                                  	; ds = cs
 20635                                  
 20636                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20637                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20638                                  
 20639 00000BD4 06                      	push	es
 20640 00000BD5 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20641 00000BD7 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20642 00000BD9 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20643 00000BDB D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20644 00000BDD B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20645 00000BDF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20646 00000BE1 05[B40B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20647 00000BE4 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20648                                  
 20649                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20650                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20651                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20652                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20653                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20654                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20655                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20656 00000BE7 A3[960B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20657                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20658 00000BEA 8816[980B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20659

 20661 00000BF1 0E                      	push	cs
 20662 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 20663 00000BF3 BE[840B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20664 00000BF6 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20665 00000BF8 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20666                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20667                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20668                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20669 00000BFA 07                      	pop	es

 20674                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20675                                  ;
 20676                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20677                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20678                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20679                                  ;		the offset.
 20680                                  ;

 20683                                  ;

 20685

 20687                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20691                                  	;
 20692 00000C02 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20693 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20694                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20695 00000C07 A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20696                                  	;
 20697 00000C0A 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20698 00000C0C 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20699 00000C0F 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20700 00000C12 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20701 00000C14 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20702 00000C16 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20703                                  	;
 20704                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20705                                  	;push	ds
 20706                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20707                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20708                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20709                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20710                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20711                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20712 00000C18 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20713                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20714 00000C1C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20715 00000C1D C3                      	retn

 20756                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20757                                  ;
 20758                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20759                                  ;
 20760                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20761                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20762                                  ;
 20763                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20764                                  
 20765                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20766                                  CPMHack:
 20767 00000C45 1E                      	push	ds
 20768 00000C46 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20769 00000C49 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20770                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20771                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20772 00000C4B 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20773 00000C4C 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20774 00000C4E BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20775 00000C51 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20776                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20777 00000C54 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20778 00000C56 FC                      	cld
 20779 00000C57 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20780 00000C59 1F                      	pop	ds

 21683                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21684                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21685                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21686                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21687                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21688                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21689                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21690                                  ;
 21691                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21692                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21693                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21694                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21695                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21696                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21697                                  ;
 21698                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21699                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21700                                  ;
 21701                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21702                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21703                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21704                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21705                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21706                                  ;
 21707                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21708                                  ;
 21709                                  ;			  none.
 21710                                  
 21711                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21712                                  ;
 21713                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21714                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21715                                  
 21716                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21717

 21922                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21923                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21924                                  ;
 21925                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21926                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21927                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21928                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21929                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21930                                  ; program).
 21931

 21933                                  
 21934                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21935                                  
 21936 000010D5 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21937

 21939                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;

 21941                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 21943                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21944                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21945                                  ; carridge return.

 21948                                  ;character after =.

 22094                                  ;
 22095                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22096                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22097                                  ;
 22098                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22099                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22100                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22101                                  
 22102                                  ParaRound:
 22103 00001153 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22104 00001156 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22105 00001158 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22106 0000115A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22107 0000115C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22108 0000115E C3                      	retn
 22109                                  
 22110                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22111                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22112                                  ;
 22113                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22114                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22115                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22116                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22117                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22118                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22119                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22120                                  ;
 22121                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22122                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22123                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22124                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22125                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22126                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22127                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22128                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22129                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22130                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22131                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22132                                  ;
 22133                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22134                                  
 22135                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22136                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22137                                  sysinit_base:				
 22138 0000115F 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22139 00001164 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22140 00001169 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22141 0000116B 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22142 00001170 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22143 00001175 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22144 00001176 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22145 00001177 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22146                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22147                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22148 00001179 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22149 0000117C 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22150 00001181 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22151                                  
 22152                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22153                                  
 22154 00001183 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22155 00001185 0E                      	push	cs
 22156 00001186 1F                      	pop	ds
 22157                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22158                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22159                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22160 00001187 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22161                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22162 0000118A CD21                    	int	21h
 22163                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22164                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22165                                  
 22166                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22167                                  stall:
 22168                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22169                                  _stall: 
 22170                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22171 0000118C F4                      	hlt 
 22172                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22173                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22174 0000118D EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22175                                  
 22176                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22177 0000118F 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22178                                  
 22179                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22180                                  
 22181                                  sum_up:
 22182                                  
 22183                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22184                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22185                                  ;
 22186                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22187                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22188                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22189                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22190                                  ;
 22191                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22192                                  
 22193 00001194 1E                      	push	ds
 22194                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22195                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22196 00001195 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22197                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22198                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22199 00001199 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22200 0000119B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22201 0000119D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22202 0000119F 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22203                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22204 000011A4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22205 000011A6 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22206                                  sum1:
 22207 000011A8 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22208 000011AA 46                      	inc	si
 22209 000011AB 46                      	inc	si
 22210 000011AC E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22211                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22212                                  sum_sys_code:
 22213                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22214 000011AE BEAE11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22215                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22216                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22217                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22218                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22219                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22220                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22221                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22222 000011B1 B9[804D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22223 000011B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22224 000011B6 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22225                                  sum2:
 22226 000011B8 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22227 000011BB 46                      	inc	si
 22228 000011BC 46                      	inc	si
 22229 000011BD E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22230 000011BF 1F                      	pop	ds
 22231 000011C0 C3                      	retn
 22232                                  
 22233                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22234                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22235                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22236                                  
 22237                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22238                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22239 000011C1 0000                    	dw	0
 22240                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22241                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22242 000011C3 0000                    	dw	0	
 22243                                  
 22244                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22245                                  
 22246                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22247                                  
 22248                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 22249 000011C5 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 22250 000011C7 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 22250 000011D0 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 22250 000011D9 6572726F722024     
 22251                                  
 22252                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 22253                                  	; 24/10/2022

 22256                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22257                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22258                                  ;
 22259                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22260                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22261                                  ;
 22262                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22263                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22264                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22265                                  ;
 22266                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22267                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22268                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22269                                  
 22270                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22271                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22272                                  
 22273                                  set_buffer:
 22274 000011E0 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22275 000011E2 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22276 000011E5 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22277 000011E7 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22278                                  set_buff_1:
 22279                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22280                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22281 000011E9 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22282                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22283 000011EB 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22284                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22285 000011EE C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22286                                  
 22287 000011F3 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22288 000011F5 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22289 000011FA 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22290                                  
 22291                                  ;	for each buffer
 22292                                  
 22293                                  nxt_buff:
 22294 000011FB E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22295 000011FE 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22296 00001200 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22297                                  
 22298 00001202 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22299                                  
 22300 00001207 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22301                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22302 00001208 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22303 0000120B 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22304                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22305                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22306 0000120D 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22307                                  
 22308 00001211 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 22309 00001213 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22310                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22311 00001215 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22312 00001219 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22313                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22314 0000121D C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22315                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22316 00001222 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22317 00001225 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22318                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22319                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22320 00001229 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22321                                  set_buff_2:
 22322 0000122C 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22323                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22324 00001231 2E800E[C514]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22325                                  	;call	round
 22326                                  	;retn
 22327                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22328 00001237 E94630                  	jmp	round
 22329                                  
 22330                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22331                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22332                                  ;
 22333                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22334                                  ;
 22335                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22336                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22338                                  
 22339                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22340                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22341 0000123A 53                      	push	bx
 22342 0000123B 52                      	push	dx
 22343 0000123C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22344 00001240 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22345                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22346 00001245 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22347                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22348                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22349                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22350 00001248 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22351 0000124A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22352 0000124C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22353                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22354 0000124F CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22355 00001251 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22356 00001254 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22357                                  	
 22358                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22359                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22360                                  	; zf=1
 22361 00001256 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22362                                  	; zf=1
 22363                                  	
 22364                                  	;zf=1
 22365                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22366                                  	;zf=1
 22367 00001257 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22368                                  got_hma:
 22369 0000125C 5A                      	pop	dx
 22370 0000125D 5B                      	pop	bx
 22371 0000125E C3                      	retn

 22376

 22378                                  ;

 22380                                  ;    ax = di
 22381                                  ;
 22382                                  ;out:
 22383                                  ;    above entries set.
 22384

 22386 0000125F 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]

 22388 00001264 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22389 00001268 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22390 0000126C 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 22391                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22392 00001271 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 22394 00001274 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22395                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22396 0000127A 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22397                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22398 00001280 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22399 00001286 C3                      	retn
 22400                                  
 22401                                  ; ======================================================================
 22402                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22403                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22404                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22405                                  
 22406                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22407                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22408                                  ;
 22409                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22410                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22411                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22412                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22413                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22414                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22415                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22416                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22417                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22418                                  ;
 22419                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22420                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22421                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22422                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22423                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22424                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22425                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22426                                  ;	conditions:
 22427                                  ;
 22428                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22429                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22430                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22431                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22432                                  ;
 22433                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22434                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22435                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22436                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22437                                  ;
 22438                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22439                                  ;
 22440                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22441                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22442                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22443                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22444                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22445                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22446                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22447                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22448                                  ;
 22449                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22450                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22451                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22452                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22453                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22454                                  ;
 22455                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22456                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22457                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22458                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22459                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22460                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22461                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22462                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22463                                  ;
 22464                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22465                                  
 22466                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22467                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22468                                  
 22469                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22470                                  stackinit:
 22471 00001287 50                      	push	ax
 22472 00001288 1E                      	push	ds
 22473 00001289 06                      	push	es
 22474 0000128A 53                      	push	bx
 22475 0000128B 51                      	push	cx
 22476 0000128C 52                      	push	dx
 22477 0000128D 57                      	push	di
 22478 0000128E 56                      	push	si
 22479 0000128F 55                      	push	bp
 22480                                  
 22481                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22482                                  
 22483                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22484                                  	; ds = cs
 22485 00001290 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22486 00001293 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22487                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22488                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22489                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22490 00001295 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22491                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22492 00001299 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22493 0000129C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22494                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22495 000012A0 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22496                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22497                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22498                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22499 000012A3 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22500                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22501 000012A7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22502 000012A9 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22503                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22504                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22505                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22506 000012AC 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22507                                  
 22508                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22509                                  
 22510                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22511                                  
 22512                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22513                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22514                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22515 000012B0 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22516                                  
 22517                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22518                                  
 22519 000012B5 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22520                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22521                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22522                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22523 000012B8 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22524 000012BA 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22525 000012BC 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22526 000012C0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22527 000012C2 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22528                                  
 22529                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22530                                  
 22531 000012C5 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22532 000012CA 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22533 000012CE F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22534 000012D0 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22535 000012D2 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22536 000012D4 06                      	push	es
 22537 000012D5 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22538                                  
 22539                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22540                                  
 22541 000012D6 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.

 23308                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23309                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23310                                  
 23311                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23312                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23313                                  
 23314                                  new_init_loop:
 23315                                  
 23316                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23317                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23318                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23319                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23320                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23321                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23322                                  
 23323 00001479 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23324 0000147C 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23325 0000147E 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23326 00001482 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23327                                  
 23328 00001485 1E                      	push	ds
 23329                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23330                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23331                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23332 00001486 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23333 00001489 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23334 0000148B 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23335 0000148E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23336 00001490 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23337 00001494 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23338 00001497 1F                      	pop	ds
 23339                                  
 23340 00001498 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23341 0000149B 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23342 0000149F C3                      	retn
 23343                                  
 23344                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23345                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 23350                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23351                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23352                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23353                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23354                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.

 23625                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23626 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23627 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23628 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23629                                  endstruc
 23630                                  
 23631                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23632                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23633                                  ;
 23634                                  ;
 23635                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23636                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23637                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23638                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23639                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23640                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23641                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23642                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23643                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23644                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23645                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23646                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23647                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23648                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23649                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23650                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23651                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23652                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23653                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23654                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23655                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23656                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23657                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23658                                  ;	   :
 23659                                  ;
 23660                                  ;Note:
 23661                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23662                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23663                                  ;
 23664                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23665                                  ;
 23666                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23667                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23668                                  ;
 23669                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23670                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23671                                  ;
 23672                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23673                                  ;
 23674                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23675                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23676                                  ;
 23677                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23678                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23679                                  ;
 23680                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23681                                  ;
 23682                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23683                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23684                                  ;
 23685                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23686                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23687                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23688                                  ;
 23689                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23690                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23691                                  ;
 23692                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23693                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23694                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23695                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23696                                  
 23697                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23698                                  
 23699                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23700                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23701                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23702                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23703                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23704                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23705                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23706                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23707                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23708                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23709                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23710                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23711                                  
 23712                                  ;**** Function flags
 23713                                  
 23714                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23715                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23716                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23717                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23718                                  
 23719                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23720                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23721 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23722 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23723 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23724 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23725 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23726 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23727                                  endstruc
 23728                                  
 23729                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23730                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23731                                  ;
 23732                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23733                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23734                                  ;	     +-
 23735                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23736                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23737                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23738                                  ;	     |	:
 23739                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23740                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23741                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23742                                  ;	     |	:
 23743                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23744                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23745                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23746                                  ;	     +-	:
 23747                                  ;
 23748                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23749                                  ;
 23750                                  ;Note:
 23751                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23752                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23753                                  ;
 23754                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23755                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23756                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23757                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23758                                  
 23759                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23760                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23761                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23762                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23763                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23764                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23765                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23766                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23767                                  
 23768                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23769 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23770 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23771 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23772 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23773 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23774                                  endstruc
 23775                                  
 23776                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23777                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23778                                  ;
 23779                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23780                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23781                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23782                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23783                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23784                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23785                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23786                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23787                                  ;
 23788                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23789                                  ;
 23790                                  ;            +-
 23791                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23792                                  ;	    | or
 23793                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23794                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23795                                  ;	    | or
 23796                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23797                                  ;	    | or
 23798                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23799                                  ;	    | or
 23800                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23801                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23802                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23803                                  ;	    | or
 23804                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23805                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23806                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23807                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23808                                  ;	    +-
 23809                                  ;
 23810                                  ;
 23811                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23812                                  ;      list.
 23813                                  ;
 23814                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23815                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23816                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23817                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23818

 23823 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23824 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23825                                  endstruc

 23854                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23855                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23856                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23938                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
