 23940                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23941                                  
 23942                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23943                                  ; SysParse;
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23946                                  ;
 23947                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23948                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23949                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23950                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23951                                  ;
 23952                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23953                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23954                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23955                                  ;
 23956                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23957                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23958                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23959                                  ;
 23960                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23961                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23962                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23963                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23964                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23965                                  ;
 23966                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23967                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23968                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23969                                  ;
 23970                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23971                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23972                                  ;
 23973                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23974                                  ;
 23975                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23976                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23977                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23978                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23979                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23980                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23981                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23982                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23983                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23984                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23985                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23986                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23987                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23988                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23989                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23990                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23991                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23992                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23993                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23994                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23995                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23996                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23997                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23998                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23999                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24000                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24001                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24002                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24003                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24004                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24005                                  
 24006                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24007                                  
 24008                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24009                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24010                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24011                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24012                                  
 24013                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24014                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24015                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24016                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24017                                  ;
 24018                                  
 24019                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24020                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24021                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24022                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24023                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24024                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24025                                  
 24026                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24027                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24028                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24029                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24030                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24031                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24032                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24033                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24034                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24035                                  
 24036                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24037                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24038                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24039                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24040                                  ;	     segment.
 24041                                  
 24042                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040

 24044                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24045                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24046                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24047                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 24639                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24640                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24641                                  ;
 24642                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24643                                  ;
 24644                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24645                                  ;	    AL = type
 24646                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24647                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24648                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24649                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24650                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24651                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24652                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24653                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24654                                  ;
 24655                                  ; Output:   None
 24656                                  ;
 24657                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24658                                  ;
 24659                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24660                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24661                                  
 24662                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24663 00001783 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 24672

 24676                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24677 00001799 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;

 24753                                  ;

 24760                                  ;		Time

 24767                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24770                                  ;
 24771                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format

 25056                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25057                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25058                                  ;
 25059                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25060                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25061                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25062                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25063                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25064                                  ;
 25065                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25066                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25067                                  ;
 25068                                  ; Output:    None
 25069                                  ;
 25070                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25071                                  ;
 25072                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25073                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25074                                  
 25075                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25076                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25077                                  
 25078                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25079                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25080                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25081 00001936 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25082 00001937 2E800E[D914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25083 0000193D 2E8026[D914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25084                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25085 00001943 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25086 00001946 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25087 00001948 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25088                                  
 25089 0000194A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25090 0000194C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25091                                  
 25092 0000194E 2E800E[D914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25093                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25094 00001954 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25095                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25096 00001955 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25097 00001958 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25098 00001959 C3                      	retn
 25099                                  
 25100                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25101                                  
 25102                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25103                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25104                                  
 25105                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25106                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25107 0000195A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25108 0000195B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25109 0000195C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25110 0000195D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25111 0000195E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25112 00001960 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25113 00001962 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25114                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25115 00001963 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25116 00001966 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25117 00001968 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25118                                  
 25119 0000196A E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25120 0000196D 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25121                                  
 25122 0000196F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25123 00001971 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25124                                  
 25125                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25126                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25127                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25128                                  %if 0
 25129                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25130                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25131                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25132                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25133                                  
 25134                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25135                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25136                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25137                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25138                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25139                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25140                                  
 25141                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25142                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25143                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25144                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25145                                  
 25146                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25147                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25148                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25149                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25150                                  
 25151                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25152                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25153                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25154                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25155                                  
 25156                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25157                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25158                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25159                                  %endif
 25160                                  ;****
 25161                                  %if 1
 25162                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25163                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 25164

 25360                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25361                                  ;
 25362                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25363                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25364                                  ;
 25365                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25366                                  ;
 25367                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25368                                  ;
 25369                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25370                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25371                                  
 25372                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25373                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25374 00001A3B 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25375 00001A3C 2EF606[D914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25376 00001A42 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25377                                  
 25378 00001A44 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25379 00001A45 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25380                                  
 25381                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25382 00001A46 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25383 00001A47 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25384                                  
 25385 00001A49 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25386 00001A4A C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25387                                  
 25388                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25389 00001A4B F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25390 00001A4C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25957                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25958                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25959                                  ;
 25960                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25961                                  ;
 25962                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25963                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25964                                  ;
 25965                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 25966                                  ;**********************************************************************
 25967                                  
 25968                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 25969 00001C47 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25970 00001C48 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 25973 00001C4D 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 25974 00001C4F 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25975                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 25976 00001C51 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 25977 00001C53 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25978                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 25979 00001C55 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 25980                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25981 00001C5A 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25982 00001C5C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 25983 00001C5E 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 25984                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25985 00001C62 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 25986                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25987 00001C65 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 25988 00001C67 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 25989 00001C6B 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 25990                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25991                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 25992                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 25993 00001C6D 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 25994                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 25995 00001C70 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25996 00001C71 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 25997 00001C74 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;

 26000                                  	; cx=0

 26002                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 26003                                  	; 08/07/2023

 26005                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 26006 00001C79 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26007 00001C7A 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;

 26010                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26011                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26012                                  ;
 26013                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26014                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26015                                  ;	    blanks.
 26016                                  ;
 26017                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26018                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26019                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26020                                  ;
 26021                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26022                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26023                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26024                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26025                                  
 26026                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26027                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26028                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26029                                  
 26030                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26031 00001C7C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26032 00001C7D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26033 00001C7E 2EC606[D314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26034                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26035                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26036 00001C84 2E8026[D914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26037 00001C8A 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26038 00001C8C 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26039                                  
 26040 00001C8E 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26041 00001C90 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26042                                  
 26043 00001C92 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26044 00001C94 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26045                                  
 26046                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26047                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26048                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26049                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26050                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26051                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26052                                  %if 0
 26053                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26054                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26055                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26056                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26057                                  
 26058                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26059                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26060                                  
 26061                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26062                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26063                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26064                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26065                                  %endif
 26066                                  
 26067                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26068 00001C96 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26069                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26070 00001C9B 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26071                                  
 26072                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26073 00001C9D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26074                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26075 00001C9F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26076                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26077                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26078                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26079                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26080 00001CA3 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26081                                  
 26082 00001CA5 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26083                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26084 00001CA8 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26085 00001CA9 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26086 00001CAC 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26087                                  
 26088 00001CAE E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26089                                  
 26090                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26091                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26092                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26093                                  	; cx=0 here
 26094 00001CB0 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26095                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26096                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26097 00001CB1 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26098 00001CB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26099 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26100                                  
 26101                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26102 00001CB4 2EA2[D314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26103 00001CB8 2EF606[D914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26104 00001CBE 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26105                                  
 26106 00001CC0 2E800E[D914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26107                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26108                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26109 00001CC6 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26110 00001CC8 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26112                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26113                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26114                                  ;
 26115                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26116                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26117                                  ;
 26118                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26119                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26120                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26121                                  ;
 26122                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26123                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26124                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26125                                  
 26126                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26127                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26128                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26129                                  ;
 26130                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26131                                  
 26132                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26133                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26134                                  
 26135                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26136                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26137                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26138                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26139 00001CCA BD[E214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26140                                  
 26141                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26142 00001CCD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26143 00001CCF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26144                                  
 26145                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26146 00001CD1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26147 00001CD3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26148                                  
 26149 00001CD5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26150                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26151                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26152 00001CD6 C3                      	retn
 26153                                  
 26154                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26155                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26156                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26157                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26158                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26159                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26160                                  
 26161                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26162                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26163 00001CD7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26164 00001CD9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26165                                  
 26166 00001CDB 2E800E[D914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26167                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26168                                  
 26169                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26170                                  	; cf=0
 26171                                  	;retn
 26172                                  
 26173                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26174                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26175                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26176 00001CE1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26177                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26178                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26179 00001CE2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26181                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26182                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26183                                  ;
 26184                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26185                                  ;
 26186                                  ;  Input:
 26187                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26188                                  ;
 26189                                  ;  Output:
 26190                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26191                                  ;
 26192                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26193                                  ;
 26194                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26195                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26196                                  
 26197                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26198 00001CE3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26199 00001CE4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26200 00001CE5 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26201                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26202                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26203                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26204 00001CE6 2E8B36[D614]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26205 00001CEB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26206 00001CED 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26207 00001CEF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26208 00001CF0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26209 00001CF1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26210 00001CF2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26211 00001CF3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26212 00001CF4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26213 00001CF5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26214                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26215                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26216 00001CF6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26217 00001CF8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26218 00001CFB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26219                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26220 00001CFD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26221 00001CFF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26222 00001D01 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26223 00001D02 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26224 00001D03 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26225 00001D04 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26226 00001D05 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26227 00001D06 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26228 00001D07 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26229 00001D08 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26230                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26231 00001D0A 2E8936[D414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26232 00001D0F 2E891E[D614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26233                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26234                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26235                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26236                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26237 00001D14 2EC536[D414]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26238                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26239 00001D19 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26240 00001D1C 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26241 00001D1E 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26242 00001D20 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26243 00001D22 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26244 00001D25 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26245 00001D27 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26246 00001D28 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26247                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26248 00001D2A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26249 00001D2B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26250                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26251 00001D2C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26252                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;

 26254                                  	; cf=0

 26256                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;

 26258 00001D2F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;

 26827                                  
 26828                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26829                                  ;
 26830                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26831                                  ;
 26832                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26833                                  ;
 26834                                  ;   Modification log:
 26835                                  ;
 26836                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26837                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26838                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26839                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26840                                  ;
 26841                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26842                                  ;
 26843                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26844                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26845                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26846                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26847                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26848                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26849                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26850                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26851                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26852                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26853                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26854                                  ;
 26855                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26856                                  
 26857                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26858                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26859                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26860                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26861                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26862                                  
 26863                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26864                                  
 26865                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26866                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26867                                  
 26868                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26869                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26870                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26871                                  
 26872                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26873                                  ;
 26874                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26875                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26876                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26877                                  ;	           line.
 26878                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26879                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26880                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26881                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26882                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26883                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26884                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26885                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26886                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26887                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26888                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26889                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26890                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26891                                  ;	           for details).
 26892                                  
 26893 00001F31 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26894 00001F32 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26895 00001F33 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26896 00001F35 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26897 00001F36 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26898 00001F46 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26899 00001F66 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26900 00001F67 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26901 00001F68 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26902                                  
 26903                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26904                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26905                                  
 26906                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26907                                  
 26908                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26909

 26922 00001F6D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26923 00001F6F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 26991 00001FAF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h

 26995 00001FB5 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay

 27013                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27014 00001FCE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27015                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27016                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.

 27031 00001FDF E871F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27032 00001FE2 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27033                                  
 27034                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27035                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27036                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27037                                  ;
 27038                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27039                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27040                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27041                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27042                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27043                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27044                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27045                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27046                                  ;
 27047 00001FE4 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27048 00001FE5 8916[BE14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27049 00001FE9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27050                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 27053

 27057

 27059                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27060                                  	;call    TempCDS

 27062                                  	; 11/12/2022

 27064                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27065                                  
 27066                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27067                                  	; ds = cs
 27068 00001FF6 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27069                                  	
 27070 00001FFA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27071 00001FFC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27072                                  
 27073 00001FFE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27074                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27075                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27076 00002000 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27077                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh

 27080 00002005 9C                      	pushf
 27081                                  
 27082                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27083                                  
 27084 00002006 50                      	push	ax
 27085 00002007 57                      	push	di
 27086 00002008 51                      	push	cx
 27087 00002009 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27088 0000200B 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27089 0000200D E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27090 0000200F F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27091 00002011 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27092                                  
 27093                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27094                                  
 27095 00002013 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27096                                  
 27097                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27098                                  
 27099                                  puteol:
 27100 00002014 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27101 00002016 AA                      	stosb
 27102 00002017 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27103 00002019 AA                      	stosb
 27104 0000201A 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27105                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27106                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27107                                  
 27108                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27109                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27110 0000201C 0E                      	push	cs
 27111 0000201D 1F                      	pop	ds
 27112                                  
 27113 0000201E 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27114                                  
 27115 00002022 59                      	pop	cx
 27116 00002023 5F                      	pop	di
 27117 00002024 58                      	pop	ax
 27118                                  
 27119                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27120                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27121                                  	;push	cs
 27122                                  	;pop	ds

 27125                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27126 00002026 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27127 00002028 CD21                    	int	21h
 27128 0000202A 58                      	pop	ax
 27129 0000202B 9D                      	popf
 27130 0000202C 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 27131 0000202E 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 27132 00002030 742D                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27133                                  conferr:

 27135 00002035 E87E24                  	call	badfil
 27136                                  ;endconv:	; 01/01/2023

 27140                                  ;
 27141                                  ; entry : multi_pass

 27152 0000203B 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27153                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27154 00002040 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27155                                  
 27156                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27157 00002042 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]

 27159                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27160 00002046 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 27161                                  
 27162 00002047 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27163 0000204B 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27164 0000204F 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0

 27166 00002055 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27167

 27174

 27177                                  	; ds = cs
 27178 0000205F E81816                          call    organize                ; organize the file

 27180                                  conflp: 
 27181 00002065 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 27182                                  
 27183 00002067 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27184                                  
 27185                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27186 0000206B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27187                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27188                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27189 0000206D 8826[C214]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27190 00002071 8826[C514]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27191                                  
 27192 00002075 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27193 00002077 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27194                                  
 27195                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27196                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27197                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27198                                  ;%if 0
 27199                                  
 27200                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27201                                  
 27202                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27203                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27204                                  
 27205 00002079 A2[C014]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27206                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27207 0000207C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27208                                  
 27209                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27210 0000207E 3826[C114]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27211                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27212 00002082 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27213                                  
 27214 00002084 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27215 00002085 E8B521                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27216 00002088 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27217 0000208A E8B021                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27218 0000208D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27219 0000208F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27220 00002092 58                              pop     ax
 27221                                  ;
 27222                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27223                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27224                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27225                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27226                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27227                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27228                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27229                                  ;   spot.
 27230                                  ;
 27231                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27232                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27233                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27234                                  ;   retrieved.
 27235                                  ;
 27236 00002093 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27237 00002098 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27238                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27239 0000209A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27240 0000209F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27241 000020A1 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27242 000020A6 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27243                                  final:                                  ;
 27244 000020A8 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27245                                  not_final:                              ;
 27246                                  ;endif
 27247                                  
 27248                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27249                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27250                                  
 27251 000020AB 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27252 000020AD E88D21                  	call	getchr
 27253 000020B0 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27254                                  
 27255 000020B2 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27256                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27257                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27258 000020B7 73A5                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27259 000020B9 E95608                  	jmp	badop
 27260                                  	
 27261                                  coff:	
 27262                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27263                                  	; ds = cs
 27264                                  	;push	cs
 27265                                  	;pop	ds
 27266 000020BC E87521                  	call	newline
 27267 000020BF EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27268                                  
 27269                                  blank_line:
 27270 000020C1 E87921                  	call	getchr
 27271 000020C4 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 27272                                  
 27273                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27274                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27275                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27276                                  ;coff_p:
 27277                                  	;push	cs
 27278                                  	;pop	ds
 27279                                  
 27280                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27281                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27282                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27283                                  ;install= command.
 27284                                  
 27285                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27286                                  ;install command
 27287                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27288                                  
 27289                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27290                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27291                                  tryi:
 27292 000020C6 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 27295                                  not_init_pass:
 27296 000020D0 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=

 27299 000020D5 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27300                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27301                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27302                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27303                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27304                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27305                                  					; and before install= commands
 27306                                  					; are processed
 27307                                  
 27308 000020D7 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27309 000020DC 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27310 000020DE 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27311                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27312                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27313 000020E1 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27314                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27315                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27316                                  
 27317                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27318                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27319                                          
 27320 000020E3 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27321                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27322 000020E6 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27323                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 27329 000020ED EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27330                                  
 27331                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27332                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)

 27334                                  ;%if 0
 27335                                  precheck_installhigh:
 27336 000020EF 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH

 27338                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27339 000020F4 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27340 000020F9 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 27341                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27342                                  
 27343                                  multi_try_i:
 27344 000020FB 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?

 27346 000020FE 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh

 27348                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27349

 27353                                  ;%if 0

 27357                                  ;endif

 27372                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 27374 00002112 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27375                                  ;endif
 27376                                  
 27377                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27378                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27379                                  
 27380 00002114 B80058                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27381 00002117 CD21                    	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27382 00002119 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27383 0000211B 53                              push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27384

 27386 00002120 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27387 00002123 CD21                    	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27388

 27390 00002128 CD21                            int     21h                     ; get link state

 27392 0000212C 50                              push    ax                      ; save for return
 27393

 27407                                  	;jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.

 27410                                  
 27411                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27412                                  
 27413                                  multi_pass_filter:

 27418 00002150 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?

 27420

 27422 00002155 FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count

 27432                                  ; buffer command
 27433                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27434                                  
 27435                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27436                                  ;									      *
 27437                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27438                                  ;									      *
 27439                                  ; input :								      *
 27440                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27441                                  ; output:								      *
 27442                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27443                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27444                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27445                                  ;									      *
 27446                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27447                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27448                                  ; logic:								      *
 27449                                  ; {									      *
 27450                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27451                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27452                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27453                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27454                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27455                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27456                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27457                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27458                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27459                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27460                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27461                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27462                                  ;	};								      *
 27463                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27464                                  ; };									      *
 27465                                  ;									      *
 27466                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27467                                  
 27468                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27469                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27470                                  tryb:
 27471 0000215F 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'

 27474                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 27477                                  ;%if 0

 27480 00002167 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27481                                  ;endif
 27482                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27483

 27485                                  	; 18/12/2022

 27507                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27508 0000217F 813E[7D1D][721D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 27557                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27558                                  ; break command
 27559                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27560                                  
 27561                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27562                                  ;									    *
 27563                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27564                                  ;									    *
 27565                                  ; input :								    *
 27566                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27567                                  ; output:								    *
 27568                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27569                                  ;									    *
 27570                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27571                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27572                                  ; logic:								    *
 27573                                  ; {									    *
 27574                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27575                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27576                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27577                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27578                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27579                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27580                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27581                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27582                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27583                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27584                                  ;	};								    *
 27585                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27586                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27587                                  ; };									    *
 27588                                  ;									    *
 27589                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27590                                  
 27591                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27592                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27593                                  tryc:
 27594 000021C0 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27595 000021C3 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27596                                  
 27597                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27598                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27599                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27600                                  ;%if 0
 27601                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27602 000021C5 E8E21E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27603 000021C8 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27604                                  ;endif
 27605                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27606                                  
 27607 000021CA BF[831D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27608 000021CD 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27609                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27610                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27611                                  do22:
 27612 000021CF E82107                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27613 000021D2 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27614                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27615                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27616                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27617                                  ;sr22:
 27618                                  	;jmp	coff
 27619                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27620 000021D4 E94B06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27621                                  if22:
 27622 000021D7 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27623 000021DA 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27624                                  
 27625                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27626 000021DC 803E[7C1D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27627 000021E1 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27628

 28233                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
