 29171                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29172                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29173                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29174                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29175                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29176                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29177                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29178                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29179                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29180                                  
 29181                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29182                                  ;									  *
 29183                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29184                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29185                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29186                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29187                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29188                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29189                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29190                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29191                                  ; input :								  *
 29192                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29193                                  ; output:								  *
 29194                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29195                                  ;									  *
 29196                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29197                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29198                                  ; logic:								  *
 29199                                  ; {									  *
 29200                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29201                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29202                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29203                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29204                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29205                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29206                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29207                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29208                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29209                                  ;	     }								  *
 29210                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29211                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29212                                  ;	};								  *
 29213                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29214                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29215                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29216                                  ; };									  *
 29217                                  ;**************************************************************************

 29964                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29965                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29966                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot

 29968                                  ;
 29969                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29970                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29971                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29972                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29973                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29974                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29975                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29976                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29977                                  ;	 procedure.

 29979                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29980                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29981                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 30327                                  ;
 30328                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30329                                  ;
 30330                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30331                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30332                                  ;
 30333                                  ;	Output : none
 30334                                  ;
 30335                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30336                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30337                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30338                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30339                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30350 0000299E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30351                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30352                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30353                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 30369                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30370                                  ;
 30371                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30372                                  ;
 30373                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30374                                  ;	Output : none
 30375                                  ;
 30376                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30377                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30378                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30379                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30380                                  ;
 30381                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30382                                  
 30383                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30384                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30385 000029AA 1E                      	push	ds
 30386 000029AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30387 000029AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30388 000029B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30389 000029B4 2E891E[8B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30390 000029B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30391 000029BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30392 000029BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30393 000029C0 2EC606[8A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30394 000029C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30395                                  ;limx:
 30396 000029C7 C3                      	retn
 30397                                  
 30398                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30399                                  ;
 30400                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30401                                  ;
 30402                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30403                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30404                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30405                                  ;
 30406                                  ;	Output : none
 30407                                  ;
 30408                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30409                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30410                                  ;
 30411                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30412                                  
 30413                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30414                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30415                                  	; ds = cs
 30416 000029C8 803E[8A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30417                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30418                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30419                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30420 000029CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30421                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30422 000029CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30423 000029D2 8826[8A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30424                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30425                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30426 000029D6 1E                      	push	ds
 30427                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30428 000029D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30429 000029D9 2EA1[8B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30430 000029DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30431 000029E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 30432                                  timx:
 30433 000029E1 C3                      	retn

 30486                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 30488                                  
 30489                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30490                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30491                                  
 30492                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30493                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30494                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30495                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30496                                  
 30497                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30498                                  ;
 30499                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30500                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30501                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30502                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30503                                  ;
 30504                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30505                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30506                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30507                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30508                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30509                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30510                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30511                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30512                                  ; available during the load.
 30513                                  ;
 30514                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30515                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30516                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30517                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30518                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30519                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30520                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30521                                  ;
 30522                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30523                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30524                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30525                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30526                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30527                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30528                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30529                                  ;
 30530                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30531                                  
 30532                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30533                                  
 30534                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30535                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30536                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30537                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30538                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30539                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30540                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30541                                  
 30542                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30543                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30544                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30545                                  
 30546                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30547                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30548                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30549                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30550                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30551                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30552                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30554                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30555                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30556                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30557                                  
 30558                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30559                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30560                                  
 30561                                  InitVar:
 30562                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30563                                  	; ds = cs
 30564                                  
 30565                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30566                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30567                                  	;push	ax
 30568                                  	;push	cx
 30569                                  	;push	di
 30570 00002A0C 06                      	push	es
 30571                                  
 30572                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30573 00002A0D 0E                      	push	cs
 30574 00002A0E 07                      	pop	es
 30575                                  
 30576 00002A0F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30577                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30578                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30579                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30580                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30581                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30582                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30583                                  
 30584                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30585                                  	; ds = cs
 30586 00002A11 A2[321F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30587 00002A14 A2[311F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30588 00002A17 A3[331F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30589 00002A1A C606[351F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30590                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30591 00002A1F A2[681F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30592                                  
 30593 00002A22 FC                      	cld
 30594                                  
 30595 00002A23 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30596 00002A26 BF[361F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30597 00002A29 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30598                                  
 30599                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30600                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30601 00002A2B B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30602 00002A2D BF[461F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30603 00002A30 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30604                                  
 30605                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30606                                  
 30607                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30608 00002A32 07                      	pop	es
 30609                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30610                                  	;pop	di
 30611                                  	;pop	cx
 30612                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30613                                  
 30614 00002A33 C3                      	retn
 30615                                  
 30616                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30617                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30618                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30619                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30620                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30621                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30622                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30623                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30624                                  
 30625                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30626                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30627                                  FixMem:
 30628                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30629                                  	;push	ax
 30630                                  	;push	bx
 30631                                  	;push	cx
 30632                                  	;push	dx
 30633 00002A34 06                      	push	es
 30634                                  
 30635 00002A35 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30636                                  
 30637 00002A38 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30638 00002A3B 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30639                                  
 30640 00002A3D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30641                                  
 30642                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30643                                  
 30644 00002A3F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30645 00002A41 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30646 00002A43 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30647                                  
 30648                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30649                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30650                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30651                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30652                                  
 30653 00002A44 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30654 00002A48 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30655 00002A4D 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30656 00002A4F 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30657                                  
 30658                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30659                                  
 30660 00002A51 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30661 00002A56 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30662 00002A58 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30663                                  
 30664 00002A5C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30665                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30666                                  	; 11/07/2023

 30669

 30679

 30686 00002A7F 07                      	pop	es
 30687                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30688                                  	;pop	dx
 30689                                  	;pop	cx
 30690                                  	;pop	bx
 30691                                  	;pop	ax
 30692                                  
 30693 00002A80 C3                      	retn

 30723 00002A8C BB0100                  	mov	bx,1

 30759                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30760                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30761                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30762                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30763                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30764                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30765                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30766                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30767                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30768                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30769                                  ;
 30770                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30771                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30772                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30773                                  ;
 30774                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30775                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30776                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30777                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30778                                  ;
 30779                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30780                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30781                                  ;
 30782                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30783                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30784                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30785                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30786                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30787                                  ;     lh
 30788                                  ;     /l
 30789                                  ;     1
 30790                                  ;     1000
 30791                                  ;     2
 30792                                  ;     print
 30793                                  ;     /d
 30794                                  ;     :lpt2
 30795                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30796                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30797                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30798                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30799                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30800                                  ; for:
 30801                                  ;    Each /L
 30802                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30803                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30804                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30805                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30806                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30807                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30808                                  
 30809                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30810                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30811                                  
 30812                                  ParseVar:
 30813                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30814                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30815                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30816 00002A9E 1E                      	push	ds
 30817 00002A9F 06                      	push	es
 30818                                  
 30819 00002AA0 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30820 00002AA1 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30821 00002AA2 FC                      	cld
 30822                                  
 30823                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30824                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30825                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30826                                  
 30827 00002AA3 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30828 00002AA4 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30829 00002AA7 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30830                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30831 00002AA9 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30832 00002AAB 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30833                                  
 30834 00002AAD 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30835 00002AAE F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30836 00002AAF EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30837                                  
 30838 00002AB1 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30839                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30840 00002AB2 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30841                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30842 00002AB4 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30843 00002AB6 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30844                                  
 30845                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30846 00002AB8 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30847                                  
 30848                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30849                                  	;
 30850                                  	;push	es
 30851                                  	;push	cs
 30852                                  	;pop	es
 30853                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30854                                  	;pop	es
 30855                                  
 30856 00002ABD 2EC606[321F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30857                                  
 30858 00002AC3 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30859                                  
 30860                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30861 00002AC5 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30862 00002AC7 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30863                                  
 30864                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30865 00002AC9 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30866                                  
 30867 00002ACE E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30868 00002AD1 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30869                                  
 30870 00002AD3 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30871 00002AD4 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30872                                  
 30873                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30874 00002AD6 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30875 00002AD9 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30876 00002ADA 4E                      	dec	si
 30877 00002ADB F9                      	stc
 30878                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30879 00002ADC 07                      	pop	es
 30880 00002ADD 1F                      	pop	ds
 30881                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30882                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30883 00002ADE C3                      	retn
 30884                                  
 30885                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30886                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30887                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30888                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30889                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30890                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30891                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30892                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30893                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30894                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30895                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30896                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30897                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30898                                  
 30899                                  parseL:
 30900 00002ADF AC                      	lodsb
 30901 00002AE0 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30902 00002AE2 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30903                                  
 30904                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30905                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30906                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30907                                  
 30908 00002AE4 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30909 00002AE7 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30910 00002AE9 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30911                                  
 30912 00002AEC 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30913 00002AEE E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30914 00002AF1 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30915                                  
 30916                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30917 00002AF3 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30918                                  
 30919 00002AF8 AC                      	lodsb
 30920 00002AF9 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30921 00002AFB 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30922                                  
 30923 00002AFD E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30924 00002B00 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30925                                  
 30926 00002B02 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30927 00002B05 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30928                                  
 30929                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30930 00002B07 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30931 00002B09 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30932                                  
 30933 00002B0B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30934 00002B0D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30935                                  
 30936                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30937                                  
 30938 00002B0F E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30939 00002B12 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30940                                  
 30941 00002B14 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30942                                  
 30943 00002B17 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30944                                  
 30945                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30946 00002B1A 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30947                                  
 30948 00002B1F AC                      	lodsb
 30949 00002B20 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30950 00002B22 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30951                                  
 30952 00002B24 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30953 00002B27 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30954                                  
 30955 00002B29 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30956 00002B2C 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30957                                  
 30958                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30959 00002B2E 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30960 00002B30 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30961                                  plE1:	
 30962                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30963 00002B32 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30964 00002B35 4E                      	dec	si
 30965 00002B36 F9                      	stc
 30966 00002B37 C3                      	retn
 30967                                  
 30968                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30969 00002B38 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30970                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30971                                  	; cf=1
 30972                                  	;stc
 30973 00002B3B C3                      	retn
 30974                                  plSwX:	
 30975 00002B3C 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30976                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30977                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30978                                  	; cf=0
 30979                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30980 00002B3D C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30981                                  
 30982                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30983                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 30984                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30990

 31001

 31003

 31006                                  
 31007                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31008                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31010                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31011                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31012                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31013                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31015                                  
 31016                                  isEOL:
 31017 00002B3E 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31018 00002B40 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31019 00002B42 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31020 00002B44 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31021 00002B46 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31022                                  ieX:	
 31023 00002B48 C3                      	retn
 31024                                  
 31025                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31026                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31027                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31028                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31029                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31030                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31031                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31032                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31033                                  
 31034                                  isWhite:
 31035 00002B49 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31036 00002B4B 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31037 00002B4D 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31038 00002B4F 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31039 00002B51 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31040                                  iwX:	
 31041 00002B53 C3                      	retn
 31042                                  
 31043                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31044                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 31045                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31093                                  
 31094                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31095                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31096                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31097                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31098                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31099                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31100                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31101                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31102                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31103                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31104                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31105                                  
 31106                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31107                                  stowUMB:
 31108 00002B67 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31109 00002B69 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31110 00002B6B F9                      	stc
 31111 00002B6C C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31112                                  su10:	
 31113                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31114                                  	;push	bx
 31115                                  	;push	di
 31116                                  	;push	si
 31117                                  	;push	ds
 31118                                  	;push	es
 31119                                  	;push	cs
 31120                                  	;pop	es
 31121                                  	;push	cs
 31122                                  	;pop	ds
 31123                                  
 31124                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31125                                  	; ds <> cs
 31126                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31127 00002B6D 2E803E[351F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31128                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31129 00002B73 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31130 00002B75 2EA2[351F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31131                                  
 31132                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31133                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31134                                  	;jne	short su20
 31135                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31136                                  su20:	
 31137 00002B79 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31138 00002B7B 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31139                                  
 31140                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31141                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31142                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31143                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31144 00002B7D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31145 00002B7F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31146 00002B81 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31147                                  
 31148                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31149                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31150 00002B83 2E8687[361F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31151                                  
 31152                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31153                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 31155                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 31156                                  	
 31157                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31158 00002B88 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31159 00002B8A F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31160                                  su30:	
 31161                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31162                                  	;pop	es
 31163                                  	;pop	ds
 31164                                  	;pop	si
 31165                                  	;pop	di
 31166                                  	;pop	bx
 31167 00002B8B C3                      	retn
 31168                                  
 31169                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 31170                                  %if 0

 31207                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31208                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31209                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31210                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31211                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 31212                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31213                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31214                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31215                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31216                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31217                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31218                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31219                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31220                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31221                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31222                                  
 31223                                  gnradix:
 31224 00002B8C 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31225                                  
 31226                                  toDigit:
 31227 00002B8E 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31228 00002B94 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31229                                  
 31230                                  toDigit_hex:
 31231 00002B96 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31232 00002B99 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31233 00002B9B 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31234 00002B9E 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 31235 00002BA0 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31236                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31237 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 31238                                  td10:	
 31239 00002BA4 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31240 00002BA7 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 31241 00002BA9 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31242 00002BAC 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 31243 00002BAE 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31244                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31245 00002BB1 C3                      	retn
 31246                                  toDigit_dec:
 31247                                  td20:	
 31248 00002BB2 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31249                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31250 00002BB5 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31251 00002BB7 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31252 00002BBA 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31253 00002BBC 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31254                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31255 00002BBF C3                      	retn
 31256                                  tdE:	
 31257 00002BC0 F9                      	stc
 31258                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31259 00002BC1 C3                      	retn
 31260                                  
 31261                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31262                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31263                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31264                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31265                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31266                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31267                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31268                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31269                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31270                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31271                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31272                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31273                                  
 31274                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31275                                  
 31276                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31277                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31278                                  
 31279                                  GetXNum:
 31280                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31281                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31282                                  	;push	bx
 31283 00002BC2 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31284                                  	;push	ds
 31285                                  
 31286 00002BC3 FC                      	cld
 31287 00002BC4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31288 00002BC6 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31289 00002BC8 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31290 00002BCA 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31291                                  
 31292 00002BCC 2EC706[8C2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31293                                  
 31294 00002BD3 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31295                                  	;call	toDigit
 31296 00002BD6 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31297                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31298                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31299 00002BD9 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31300                                  
 31301 00002BDB 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31302 00002BDD 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31303 00002BDF 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31304 00002BE3 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31305 00002BE6 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31306 00002BE8 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31307 00002BEB 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31308                                  
 31309                                  gxn10:	
 31310 00002BED 2EC706[8C2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31311 00002BF4 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31312 00002BF5 46                      	inc	si
 31313                                  
 31314                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31315                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31316                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31317                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31318                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31319                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31320                                  
 31321                                  gxn20:	
 31322 00002BF6 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31323 00002BF9 46                      	inc	si
 31324                                  
 31325 00002BFA E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31326 00002BFD 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31327                                  
 31328 00002BFF E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31329 00002C02 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31330                                  
 31331 00002C04 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31332 00002C06 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31333                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31334                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31335 00002C08 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31336                                  gxnE:	
 31337                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31338 00002C0A EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31339                                  gxnQ:	
 31340 00002C0C 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31341 00002C0D F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31342                                  gxnX:	
 31343                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31344                                  	;pop	ds
 31345 00002C0E 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31346                                  	;pop	bx
 31347 00002C0F C3                      	retn
 31348                                  
 31349                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31350                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31352                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31353                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31354                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31355                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31356                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31357                                  
 31358                                  mul32:
 31359 00002C10 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31360 00002C11 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31361 00002C13 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31362 00002C18 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31363                                  
 31364 00002C1A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31365 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31366                                  
 31367 00002C1D 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31368 00002C1F 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31369 00002C24 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31370 00002C26 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31371 00002C28 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31372 00002C2A C3                      	retn
 31373                                  m32E:	
 31374 00002C2B 58                      	pop	ax
 31375 00002C2C C3                      	retn
 31376                                  
 31377                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31378                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31379                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31380                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31381                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31382                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31383                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31384                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31385                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31386                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31387                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31388                                  
 31389                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31390                                  toPara:
 31391 00002C2D 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31392                                  
 31393 00002C2E B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31394 00002C30 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31395 00002C32 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31396 00002C33 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31397 00002C35 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31398 00002C37 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31399                                  
 31400 00002C39 59                      	pop	cx
 31401 00002C3A C3                      	retn

 31403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31404                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31406                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31407                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31408                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31409                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31410                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31411                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31412                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31413                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31414                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31415                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31416                                  
 31417                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31418                                  UmbHead:
 31419                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31420                                  
 31421                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31422                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31423                                  	;push	es
 31424                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31425                                  
 31426                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31427                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31428                                  
 31429 00002C3B B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31430 00002C3D CD21                    	int	21h
 31431                                  
 31432 00002C3F 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31433                                  	
 31434                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31435 00002C43 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31436 00002C46 F5                      	cmc
 31437                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31438 00002C47 C3                      	retn
 31439                                  
 31440                                  ; 01/01/2023
 31441                                  ;%if 0
 31442                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31443                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 31444                                  ;
 31445                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 31446                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 31447                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 31448                                  ;	retn
 31449                                  ;uhE:	
 31450                                  ;	stc
 31451                                  ;uhX:	
 31452                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 31453                                  ;	;pop	es
 31454                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?

 31456                                  ;	retn

 31459                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31460                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 31461                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31462                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 31463                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 31464                                  ; USES:   Flags
 31465                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31466

 31472                                  	;je	short ism10

 31474                                  	;;je	short ism10
 31475                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 31476                                  	;jne	short ismX
 31477 00002C48 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 31478 00002C4E 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 31479                                  ism10:	
 31480                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 31481                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 31482 00002C50 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 31483                                  ismX:	
 31484                                  	;pop	ax

 31488                                  
 31489                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31490                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31491                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31492                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31493                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31494                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31495                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31496                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31497                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31498                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31499                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31500                                  ;      ...
 31501                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31502                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31503                                  
 31504                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31505                                  AddrToUmb:
 31506                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31507                                  	;push	cx
 31508                                  	;push	dx
 31509 00002C58 06                      	push	es
 31510                                  
 31511 00002C59 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31512                                  
 31513 00002C5B E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31514 00002C5E 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31515                                  
 31516                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31517                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31518 00002C60 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31519                                  
 31520                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31521                                  atu10:
 31522 00002C62 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 31523                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31524                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31525                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31526                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31527                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31528                                  
 31529                                  ;atu10:	
 31530                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 31531 00002C64 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31532 00002C66 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31533                                  
 31534 00002C68 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31535 00002C6B 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31536                                  
 31537 00002C6D 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31538                                  atu20:	
 31539                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31540                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31541                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31542                                  	; ax = es
 31543                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31544 00002C6E 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31545 00002C73 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31546 00002C79 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31547                                  
 31548                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31549                                  
 31550                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31551                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31552                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31553 00002C7B 40                      	inc	ax
 31554                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31555                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31556 00002C7C EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31557                                  
 31558                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31559                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31560                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31561                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31562                                  
 31563                                  atu30:	
 31564                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31565                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31566                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31567                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31568 00002C7E 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31569 00002C80 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31570                                  atuE:	
 31571 00002C82 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31572 00002C84 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31573                                  atuX:	
 31574 00002C85 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31575                                  	
 31576 00002C87 07                      	pop	es	
 31577                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31578                                  	;pop	dx
 31579                                  	;pop	cx
 31580 00002C88 C3                      	retn
 31581                                  
 31582                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31583                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31584                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31585                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31586                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31587                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31588                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31589                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31590                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31591                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31592                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31593                                  
 31594                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31595                                  convUMB:
 31596 00002C89 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31597 00002C8F 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31598 00002C91 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31599                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31600                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31601                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31602                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31603 00002C94 40                      	inc	ax
